Comment:Sophomore:I feel as if Narragansett Middle School really prepped me for what was to lie ahead. Starting in the seventh grade, advanced classes were made available to the students. For example, I took pre-algebra in the seventh grade in place of the seventh-grade math class. As a result, I was able to take Algebra in the eighth grade. In eighth grade, they incorporated an "ACE" program. The ACE program allowed me to essentially skip a grade, but still be in the same graduating class. The teachers did an excellent job of preparing us for more advanced classes; the transition from seventh grade to ninth grade level classes in one year was made simple. The middle school also did an excellent job at providing extra-curricular activities for students....

There is also lots of parent AND student involvement which creates a great school environment....

Comment:Alum:Overall, my experience was positive. Most of my teachers were fabulous. There is the occasional hard teacher who gives you a tough time, but for the most part if you're open, communicative, do your work, and pay attention you'll do very well. The Administration fell apart after the principal and vice principal left, now they've seemed to get things back under control. However, somebody thought it would be a good idea not to renew the contract of the theatre manager. Lots of people were upset over this decision because of how fabulous he was. He wasn't just great at what he did, but he helped anyone with anything. Now they have a new theatre manager who works part time from home whereas the previous two were full time and always running around seeing to general maintenance in the theatre. Seeing as it's a really nice theatre, it's too bad to see so little going on in the theatre. They do have new band and theatre teachers though, so it will be interesting to see what they fight for....

abbreviation: Francis W. Parker Charter Essential School
school_name: Francis W. Parker Charter Essential School
review: Comment:Parent:As a parent of 3 Parker graduates, I still feel that “winning” the Parker lottery was better than winning the actual lottery! All 3 of my children were accepted into fantastic college programs -honors- and all 3 are currently working in chosen fields, enjoying what they do, living on their own and supporting themselves. Friendships made at Parker are still quite strong today. Interests that grew in the 7th-12th grades are hobbies today. Parker taught them how to BE students and thinkers. Teachers care so much about their students. Students develop public speaking, presentation, & communication skills. They develop habits for learning & take those habits into college and work.They learn how to listen & how to ask questions. Parker offers real-world learning. Students apply all learning to real world situations. They don’t just memorize information. It always felt like a private school education for free. Amazing school ! What a fantastic experience for our entire family....

school_name: Saint Paul Diocesan Jr - Sr High School
review: Comment:Senior:Saint Paul is, foremost, a community. A community of teachers and students who treat each other warmly and are willing to cooperate for the sake of education. This warmness was what helped me to excel in Saint Paul as a student....

Comment:Middle School Student:I would say that the teachers I've had at McCarthy-Towne have been overall good. Since I am graduating this year (6th Grade) I'll have been going there for four years. My first teacher (3rd Grade) was very nice and welcoming, so was my second but in 5th grade my teacher was really mean and controlling. This year they are preparing us for Jr. High so we have two "main" teachers who are both really nice in their own ways. One thing I dislike about the school is the food, if you are considering  sending your child her make sure to pack their lunch! Another is the fact that they don't really prepare you for the Jr. High in the sense that there is barely any homework. Overall a good school though....

Comment:Niche User:It is an excellent school where our children have had extraordinary development, from science to art to sports.  It is a blessing to be able to receive the fine education of this school and its educational staff....

Comment:Parent:Grateful my kids have been raised in this community. We are so lucky with the amount of education and 1:1 attention each of our children received when they were here whether academically or emotionally as they grew. It is a small, diverse and academically excellent elementary school where it's teachers work hard and the students thrive because of it. The students are very well prepared for life after Grade 5 as they transition into the Middle School on the other side of town. There are many offerings before and after school from Gym, Orff, to Art and Service Club...plus many outside athletic organizations that offer sports after school. It's a great school for anyone coming in as a resident or who is able to choice in from out of the district....

Comment:Alum:I graduated from Douglas in 2020. Overall it was a fun seven years of my life, but I didn't learn much. I started there in Kindergarten and ended in 6th grade. I can't say the academics were horrible, because I learned a few things, but I was never "challenged." There was minimal homework to back up what we learned, which didn't help much with the fact that we were there to learn. I liked most of my teachers. My favorite experiences were in 5th and 6th grade. In 5th grade for our exhibitions, my class created a website called the "Team 5 Times." Another one of my favorite 5th-grade projects was the Oregon Trail. We turned our desks and tables into wagons, used power tools, and made our own games. (I made a geyser and helped with the Oregon Trail game). My favorite 6th-grade moments were Nature's Classroom (a 3-day overnight field trip) and our class play. Overall, Douglas wasn't the best place to learn and grow academically, but there are still many great experiences....

school_name: Hampden Charter School of Science West
review: Comment:Parent:Hampden Charter School of Science West offers a wonderful learning atmosphere. The administration is extremely dedicated to helping all students reach their academic and athletic goals. The students are not just a number, they are truly cared about.  Teachers respond to communications extremely fast and with a high level of thoughtfulness.  It is a college prep school that assists its' students with a hands-on approach to the college application process. HCSS consistently shows their forward momentum by trying to offer more extra curriculars and athletic programs.   They also offer an array of AP courses that can be taken starting Freshman year.  lastly, HCSS's approach to safety is top notch.  Security guards are onsite daily, safety procedures are practiced (ie. drills) and there is clear visitor protocol.  Overall, I highly recommend this school to any parents looking for an alternative to a traditional public school experience....

Comment:Middle school student:Joshua Eaton is the best school ever. I graduated last year and I loved it. My teachers were awesome, the principal actually knew my name and would joke around with me in the hallways and I learned a lot. Student council was fun and safeties was fun too. Recommend!...

Comment:Alum:High school at Margarita Muñiz Academy shaped my character and initially struggling to make friends, I persevered and formed unbreakable bonds. Overcoming initial challenges, I found support in the chess club and band.Comment:The chess club honed strategic thinking, teaching perseverance and helping me achieve third place in an all-school tournament!. The band allowed for artistic expression and a sense of accomplishment through performances.Comment:Observing the impact of stress on well-being, I advocate for increased mental health accessibility. Schools should provide more counseling resources and relaxation periods, prioritizing students' well-being through practices like the Pomodoro technique.Comment:Margarita Muñiz Academy provided cherished memories, lasting friendships, and personal growth. Reflecting on my journey, I emphasize the need for enhanced mental health accessibility. Margarita Muñiz Academy shaped my perspective and will contribute to my future endeavors ....

Comment:Parent:I am very pleased with the Pilot Mason School. Comment:Parent:I have 3 kids. 2 went to Medfield and my son is my 3rd. My son has Social Skill issues, and we had a hard time last year with labels of ADHD. BUT, For Fallbrook, the school, & faculty, I give 5 stars (If My child was an angel). I took 1 star away for labeling ADHD at age 6! ADHD is a dr’s diagnose. These are small kids going to school for the first time & in my honest opinion every issue I’ve had since K, ( My son is now in 2nd) has been attended to, not only 1-on-1 but with added support of the District. There are Special programs for kids that need it, lots of events and fun fairs. The principle is perfect for an elementary school even when I was upset he never changed his “positive” ways.  Im glad my son is attending this school. He has an AWESOME teacher this year. I would Recommend Fallbrook Elementary to anyone that would ask....

Comment:Middle School Student:It was an overall great experience to go to PCIS. Many of the staff members were fun and engaging and while there were some but fewer teachers who had a certain aura surrounding them. But all in all a great experience....

Comment:Alum:All in all it was a good high school experience. We got a new building during my junior year and I felt that the upgrade helped improve my ability to learn. I do hope that the coaches in high school athletics begin to pay more attention to the attitudes and feelings that athletes have towards their teammates, and address those issues when necessary, and involve administrators when necessary. The protection of students is the most important and was sometimes overlooked due to favoritism. But I did enjoy my time at Wahconah and I am glad I chose to school choice there!...

Comment:Senior:I had an amazing four years at Minnechaug. I learned so much about myself and really grew into my own skin. This was was all with the help of my teachers pushing me to do my best. If I had to tell a freshman one thing before they entered high school and Minnechaug I would say; take advantage of everything, get involved, go on the trips, join the clubs, tryout for the team. school_name: Hampden Charter School of Science East
review: Comment:Junior:I love Hampden Charter School of Science! This is the best school I have been to so far in every way. Comment:Senior:Overall, Sutton High School is an amazing place. With access to tens of resources --for colleges, scholarships, etc. -- the school has much to offer. For example, while the school is unable to offer every AP class (or class in general, e.g. Investing in the Stock Market), the school does offer Virtual High School (VHS) classes that can be taken, where students take an online course (AP or otherwise) that the school is unable to offer. It is an amazing experience that allows students to delve into areas that they may be interested in but cannot take at the school due to the school not offering the elective. The only major area the school can change in is in diversity (the school has a mostly Caucasian population), but other than that there are no major complaints....
Comment:Niche User:I really loved the teachers and the new friends that i made everyday. I would want the cafeteria changed....

school_name: St. John Paul II School - High School Division
review: Comment:Alum:I attended JP2 when it was just a high school so my experience might be a little different to today, but still helpful. I felt very supported by my teachers while I attended JP2. The performing arts program gave me every opportunity possible to learn and improve skills through a multitude of classes, clubs, and performances, including a fall play and spring musical, solo night, honors choir, technical theatre, and a tour every year with the concert choir. I felt very prepared by my teachers for college and that transition. I was also given a great catholic education and got many opportunities to express my faith and help the community. The smaller school environment really brought my class together too. There were also lots of clubs to get involved in, with new ones being created each year. I look back at my time at JP2 and I’m so thankful that I was able to attend such a great school. Everything I learned there made me a better person and I still look back on them to this day....
Comment:Senior:I've been really happy my 4 years at Dedham High. I've played 3 varsity sports all 4 years and have great teachers and friends.  I will miss it....

Comment:Alum:Stepping into Worcester Technical High School feels like entering a mixed bag of experiences. As a former student, my time there was a blend of highs and lows. On the positive side, the school boasts impressive facilities and a diverse range of vocational programs. From welding to graphic design, there's something for everyone. The hands-on learning approach is commendable, providing practical skills alongside traditional academics. However, Worcester Tech isn't without its flaws. The administrative bureaucracy often feels overwhelming, making it difficult to navigate schedules and resources. Additionally, some teachers seem more focused on sticking to the curriculum than connecting with students on a personal level. The school culture can be hit or miss. In the end, Worcester Technical High School is what you make of it. It's not perfect, but it's not a lost cause either....

Comment:Senior:I transferred to this school almost a year ago. My high school experience has brought me great joy and happiness.  The sense of being included, various opportunities, skilled teachers, and the strong school spirit all lead to this being a rewarding and satisfying chapter in my life. I am happy to be a member of my high school and look forward to enjoying these memories for years to come....

Comment:Middle School Student:I am in the middle of my 9th and final year at the Kennedy, and I have had such great experiences there. I've loved all of my teachers, and have been really well supported my whole time there. They take bullying and safety very seriously. Through the years I have built strong relationships with teachers and administrators. I loved the drama club (which unfortunately may not have funding to continue), the school often does spirit weeks, mindfulness weeks, kindness weeks, etc. The school has a nice community with great parent involvement in the PTA! I've also observed plenty of extra help for students struggling academically. It was great having a pool in the basement of the school too! The Makerspace and STEAM focus in my more recent years has also been really nice. Overall, I've loved the Kennedy, and I can't think of any complaints from my experience....
Comment:Parent:My daughter started at Centerville this year. It is a great community with great administration. She is learning a lot and seems to be very happy....

Comment:Middle School Student:I think that McCall is a wonderful school. It has great teachers who care about their students and plenty of time to do homework. The only thing that is a problem is diversity. Most of the kids are white, in my time at McCall there haven't been racist comments but I do believe that the diversity needs to change. I would love to have all different types of people at school. Other than that it is a really wonderful school....

Comment:Niche User:I LOVE the Downey Elementary School! The kids are just AMAZING! No wonder the Downey Elementary School earned a Blue Ribbon award this year! The staff are amazing, and everybody at this beautiful school is kind, patient, and helpful. Every person that works, learns, and cooperates there is part of a community! This school is amazing!...

Comment:Alum:It has been years since I have been there but in my expirence it was very nice close knit school. One of the first places to start using computers to take the MCAS. I don't know if they have made any renovations but it was a pretty solid school....

Comment:Parent:My twins are finishing up Oak Hill Middle School this year and have had a fabulous experience.  The Principal is so caring of the students as well as faculty, and he works so hard to create new and relevant experiences for the kids.  Racial tolerance, LBGTQ issues and bullying are taken very seriously and my kids say the environment is welcoming for kids of all backgrounds and interests.  My son, who needs extra help, has been well cared for by the excellent team headed via the guidance counselor, who stays with the kids all three years.  The librarian is new as is the art teacher and both are young and energetic.  The music and theater program is one of the best in the state and the offerings are broad including Chinese, which my son tackled.  I can't say enough about the caring staff and teachers who work hard to support the school.  In such a large school - over 600 kids - it is amazing that everyone knows the kids names.  Very satisfied with Oak Hill....

Comment:Alum:I loved this school! Great environment, school focuses on fostering a kind community with no bullying. Class sizes are too large though (about 25 per class). Other than that, this is a great school!!...

Comment:Middle School Student:I started middle school a few months ago. The only thing wrong was BTA, or Blanchard Theatre Arts. The 6th graders get neglected a lot. When an actor gets their makeup done wrong or something else, other 7th and 8th graders say, "Oh! Was it a 6th grader?" I've seen that happen many times before. Be careful, and if you can't take that stuff, go to Mrs. Sacco, our director. She's very kind. No parents will worry about academics. I'm sure by the time we reach high school, we'll be ready to take on the world. There are many varieties of food as well, like yogurt, salad, fruit gummies, fruit in general, and muffins. Muffins are mostly for breakfast though, and yes, they give out breakfast. Drinks include milk, soda, and water on most days. Our band teacher is really funny too! Lastly, the janitors make the school squeaky clean, so no need to worry about bugs crawling all over the place. Overall, Blanchard Middle School is excellent. I would definitely recommend going there....
Comment:Parent:Caring environment. Great values. Tailored education approach. Diverse community. Parents involved. What could improve is the condition of facilities and student to teacher ratio....
Comment:Parent:The school will really prepare students academically for college. Most of the teachers are wonderful, but like most schools there are some that should not be teaching....

Comment:Alum:I loved attending Bedford High School. I’ve made connections with classmates and staff as well which is something I will forever cherish. It also made me ready and excited to start a new shooter in college which is something I am very grateful for!...

Comment:Middle School Student:This school can be outstanding. The school is a safe space for sure and learning there is definitely fun. Though the teachers often do not give fair attention to the people who need it. For instance, if a student is bullying, cussing, or being distracting, the teacher doesn't do anything but the little stuff they care about....

Comment:Parent:Incredible team of teachers and administrators.   Even with a hybrid start to the year, my daughter was ecstatic about her teachers in comparison with her previous elementary school.  Over the course of the year she learned so much and made close friendships.  An incredible outcome for a challenging year due to the team of professionals at Fiske and LPS...

Comment:Parent:We had 2 kids go though Sprague and loved it. Teachers have been really good and many opportunities for parents to participate/ visit. PTO is amazing and involved. Facilities are top notch. I’d gladly pay more for housing to be in this school district - which is the one downside; real estate is kinda crazy...
Comment:Parent:Lynch is a fabulous school!  It offers top academics, a diverse student body, caring and committed educators, and robust community involvement.  Highly recommend....

Comment:Parent:My kids have had a wonderful transition as we moved from a different town. Teachers paid special attention to them to ensure they are well integrated in the new environment while making new friends and increasing their knowledge...

Comment:Parent:I like this school Because all teachers are so hard workers they are very helpful and friendly and school is so beautiful my 2 kids goes this school  academy system is so good activities program is good...
Comment:Senior:The administration tends to try to be helpful and progressive, but the students are incredibly cynical, so much so that the work of the admin is often useless....

Comment:Middle School Student:Excellent school. Was here last 12 years ago and loved this place. I really enjoyed the nice clean hallways and much more than excellent staff who helped me grow and learn when I was in 4 - 6 grades....

Comment:Parent:I cannot say enough great things about Floral Street Elementary school. They teach to each childs individual level. There are so many resources available to the students at Floral Street School. There is a real sense of community here that is undeniable. This is an amazing school among the many amazing schools within Shrewsbury Massachusetts....

school_name: Fontbonne , The Early College of Boston
review: Comment:Alum:Overall, I loved my time at Fontbonne. A majority of the teachers were very kind and taught well. There were a few teachers who did not teach well, but overall I felt I received a quality education. I made some very good friends at Fontbonne who I still talk to today. The food is alright. It was better before COVID but due to covid they switched to pre-packaged food. It wasn't terrible, but I never found myself looking forward to anything other than the cookies, which remained the same. The Theatre program puts on good shows, but I found that the same students were always cast as the lead roles year after year. The school was very accommodating towards me when I had a mental health crisis, which I really appreciated. I felt that the Health class was very comprehensive and informative. Fontbonne made it easy to apply to college, as we were guided every step of the way. I am glad I attended Fontbonne and would choose it again....

abbreviation: Advanced Math & Science Academy Charter School
school_name: Advanced Math & Science Academy Charter School
review: Comment:Senior:I am a senior here at AMSA, and I can tell you that the school is very good. There are mainly good, but also bad parts too. First of all, the academics are very strong, as a STEM major myself I can say that the academics are very good in preparing me not only for college but also for life after college.  The teachers are very caring and they offer help whenever asked. Teachers also stay after school for office hours which helps a ton when I need to understand a specific topic or subject.Comment:As captain of the soccer team and part of the tennis team, and also working closely with the athletic director, the athletic scene is very well run and a very fun experience for all students and even parents too. Comment:One of the few issues I've had was the bad food and extremely long traffic before school.  Other than that, there is nothing negative about the school.Comment:Overall, very strong school spirit, academics, and sports, which makes it easy to see why it is ranked as a top school in Massachusetts....

Comment:Senior:This school is amazing! For the size of the school, they offer many classes and extracurriculars. They offer soccer, basketball, theater, chorus, band, track, cross country, and student-led clubs. They offer many rigorous and challenging classes (AP and honors). The teachers are always willing to give you help if you ask for it, and most are generous and flexible with their homework and project deadlines if you ask. The community is centered on Christ, leading chapel three times a week. This school has prepared me for college, and I strongly recommend it....

Comment:Parent:Our journey to find a private school for our Daughter started almost a year ago. We attended AP's open house/tour and really enjoyed hearing about AP's community from their faculty and students. We attended a second open house/tour with our Daughter in the fall who immediately felt that this was the school and community she wanted to be a part of. The Admissions team put together wonderful events on campus that would give us all more insight into their curriculum, values and community. Needless to say our Daughter applied early and was accepted. We are so excited to be part of AP's community and to see where her Austin journey will take her!...

Comment:Parent:I have had a pretty positive experience with our first grader. She's been in school since JK at MLK and in the immersion program. Half of the day is spent learning Chinese and half of the day is spent learning English. Here's what I like about the school.Comment:1. Peers. I really like her peers and parents. Everyone that I have met have been nice and I haven't worried about issues such as bullying. She goes to school happy every day, so learning comes naturally.Comment:2. Academics. I like that she is exposed to a different language. One parent explained to me that kids may not test as well in English (but surprisingly, MLK kids test just as well in English as kids from other Cantabridgian schools) because they spend half of their day learning another language. There are no standardized tests that measures the fact that you're learning another language.Comment:3. Parents. They're  great people that I'd like to hang out with even if we didn't have kids. Many are knowledgeable and fierce advocates....

Comment:Parent:My son is a 7th grader at John Glenn and loves it.  The quality of teaching is generally excellent, with enthusiastic, intelligent, motivated teachers.  He loves the 6-day class schedule, although it did take a little getting used to.  In addition, his MCAS precentages have improved into the exceeds category, showing objective improvement.  Socially, the dances have been a bit hit or miss, but middle schoolnis a tough social age.  The arts programming is excellent, music, stage, etc .... No issue with drugs, vaping, or the like to speak of.  Good sports for a middle school as well.  As a parent, we were not sure what to expect, but have been very pleased....
Comment:Sophomore:The academics and all other aspects of Trottier were outstanding in all aspects.  It easily trumps any other middle school in all categories....
Comment:Middle school student:Best- having a diverse culture and being friends with all types of people with different backgrounds and gendersComment:Worst- the food...

school_name: Helen Y. Davis Leadership Academy Charter Public School
review: Comment:Middle school student:A lot of Diversity great community. Great Academic Standards Great Teachers. An Amazing experience A lot of black excellence...

Comment:Senior:I loved this school! It was a great learning experience for me. The teachers are kind and supportive, understanding and patient, and love teaching! I got challenged at this school to learn more as a gifted student. The specials are great, such as P.E, Art, Music, and Library, they have many fun days scattered through the year. My favorite teacher, Miss Fontaine helped a lot too. The only reason this isn't 5 stars is because some of the teachers and students were racist....

Comment:Senior:Hamilton Wenham has been a place where faculty works with students to find the best path for them. Teachers are creative and innovative, and because it is a small school (around 100 students per class) most students get the opportunity to really get to know their teachers and each other....

Comment:Middle school student:Not super good, but not super bad. Fights are not rare, and student culture is harsh. Teachers are good, and the clubs and events are fun. The curriculum could be more rigorous....

Comment:Parent:This school uses an amazing approach of individualized education which places each student in the center. I was so beaten up by the cookie cutter system in public schools and some other private schools. For example, at Fusion,  besides having an infinite number of electives, you can take any language you want, you can start at the time you are are comfortable with, and you can take a vacation and not miss any classes as you will be accommodated. Every day you get an academic summary from your child’s teachers to see what your child did and what he needs to work on. Their homework club is very supportive and makes sure the students work on their executive functioning skills which are so important, especially in college. The kids socialize with each other during homework cafe, daily clubs, and monthly field trips  that are designed to foster teamwork....

Comment:Alum:Listen, every school has its issues, sure this school may hold you child to much higher standards than most, and there may or may not be a certain guidance counselor that needs to be fired, but this school is absolutely fantastic at achieving its goals. The test scores in this town would knock your socks off, I swear the median test scores here are better than the best test scores in some other towns. They are very accepting and diverse and have done so much to end typical teenage behaviours and create a safer atmosphere. The middle school is indeed far worse than the high school in this town, but compared to other towns, im just appauled to see it this far down on the list, I could throw some hard shade at half the schools above Easton on this list if I wanted to. But thats petty, and we dont do that here....

Comment:Senior:My time at Newburyport High School will forever impact myself moving forward into the next stages of life. My teachers have had a profound impact on my learning and dreams to continue to study psychology at college, largely due to my AP psych teacher Ms. P. I was fortunate enough to be on the varsity field hockey team, and this year is the first time in our school's history that we made it to the state championship finals. That was definitely one of the best experiences for me, and as a team as a whole. There is not much that I would like to see change at school, but if I had to think of one thing, it would be to have less of a sense of competition and pressure in the classroom between peers....

Comment:Junior:As a current junior in WRHS, I'm proud to say that I attend Wachusett, however, that is not to say that I have no complaints. Mentioned previously, the diversity is quite low for a regional school, and as an Asian American, it's hard to find many others with similar interest as myself. The school does create a good environment for extracurricular clubs, and I've found that the Asian Student Association, along with the Diversity Inclusion Group, among many others, fill in the gap for minority groups to come together. The academic system is also challenging to students and incorporates a variety of different classes many others schools do not hold, such as many computer sciences, automotive classes, partnership programs (child study, criminal justice), and the STEM classes are really good at introducing kids to higher level labs. For example, there are 6 WRHS students attending state science fair this year, and last year a student won first at states....

Comment:Senior:Overall, Cohasset Middle/High School is a school that challenges students to reach their full potential in regards to academics, sports, clubs, and other activities. Most students at Cohasset High School are involved in many clubs along with sports, all while maintaining a high GPA and trying challenging courses....
Comment:Parent:The Jackson school is awesome!! We have had amazing experiences there, they do a great job with IEPs and special education and a great job with students with no extra needs!...

Comment:Parent:I give the school and staff 5 stars. My little sister went from kindergarten to graduating  5th grade from there. Being on a  I.E.P they gave her everything she needed …. safety, acceptance and a sense of competence. The staff were so good to my sister and still are, they are family to her . We apriciate and love all of them!...

Comment:Sophomore:Moving from Northampton to Whately meant I had to swap schools. That would usually suck, it did seem that way to me at first. But, the staff and administration are genuinely dedicated to making sure each child is safe and has a good time here. Much better than my old elementary school *I won't name it. Doesn't deserve to be named*. They got me ready for Middle School, High School, and helped me find what I wanted to do at an early age. May not be the same for you or your child, but for me, it worked. If I ever stay in the area, I would 100% send my kid to this school. This school deserves more than it gets, and I'd 100% boost funding into it if I could. This school earned all five stars....

Comment:Middle School Student:I would like to see the bulling change but wood was the best school I have ever been to  The food was great and it was overall a good schools actually be and I loved it there I loved all the teachers I love the principal I love that we had excellent things there and the floor was clean the bathrooms were clean the afterschool activities were fun and I found out that it from all my years there I had a lot of good times with my friends my teachers  A lot and a lot of good memories a lot of them  overall I had a really good time there I feel like if you had  to pick an elementary school I pick the school it was really cool I loved everything to it.!.!.!.!.!...

Comment:Freshman:The best things  that Pope Francis Prep School offers is diversity, faith based, the staffs encouragement and engagement, curriculum sets students up for success! Comment:I have not had a negative experience. Everything has been positive....
Comment:Alum:I loved it there and current students love it there too! Such great leadership and I love the system for sorting kids by ability without them knowing that...

Comment:Senior:My AP calculus class and specifically the teacher taught me knowledge that I will further pursue as I study engineering in college. That class was a strong balance of learning and fun! I enjoyed the challenging coursework in AP classes and the hands on projects and experiments. In my AP Physics we will be building a trebuchet, which allows hands-on experience to engage in real world studies. Unique to other schools is our Patriot Pride day held twice a year where everyone in the school wears our school colors, red white and blue, and we don't have class that day but have blow up obstacle courses, barbecue food, yard games, popcorn machine and more which all the students get to enjoy outside without having schoolwork. A change I would like to see is the introduction of AP classes through freshman year, or a better handling of schedules. I often had conflicts in my schedules of two classes that I wanted to take such as this year when AP Physic and AP Statistics were run at the same time....

Comment:Senior:My experience has and is an overall good one. The academics are diverse wide variety of classes for the core curriculum with varying levels to suit each student's individual needs. The teachers are, on average, very helpful. That is not to say that I have not had some unsavory moments with the teaching methods of my teachers; however, I feel like they have prepared me enough to succeed in future academic endeavors. I have made many amazing and thoughtful connections with multiple of my teachers, they truly were and are the pillars to my education so I commend them for that. The best of my experiences may have to be in AP Economics, a class where I struggled but succeeded in at the end. My worst experiences of the school may have to be the multitude of times where classes were disrupted because of fire alarms pulled by students, however the actions of such students are in no way indicative of the school overall. I would like for the school lunch to change, more tasty please....

Comment:Alum:I attended Hampshire Regional for six years and had a great experience. The teachers are passionate and engaging, and they go out of their way to support students and provide enriching work. The English department in particular is fantastic, as they prepare students to write, think, and analyse at a very high level. As a current college student, it is evident that I received a much more rigorous education than many of my peers who attended other schools. The teachers here went above and beyond to prepare me for college, and the quality of education I received at Hampshire is entirely thanks to their dedication.Comment: It's truly a shame that the administration and school committee don't value the educators here and are unwilling to negotiate with the union or pay them the wage they deserve. It reflects very poorly on the administration to undervalue the educators. Hampshire has a good academic reputation in the area, which is due to the quality of the teachers rather than the administrators....

Comment:Parent:Teachers are amazing. School’s principal is involved and approachable and most important my son comeback from school everyday excited and happy. They offers sports,  arts and music to all the children....

Comment:Parent:In the beginning I was very devastated because how they were with me in 2017. But now is a new beginning. They are now respecting me and behavior are good. And the new principal is awesome....

Comment:Alum:I think the best part was the teachers. The worst part would have to of been the options of  elective or language classes. I would love to see the kids at Mt.Everett be able to go on more school functioned trips and be able to take classes that they'll enjoy and get them closer to what they want to study in college....
Comment:Alum:The school wasn't half bad, but it definitely needs some more diversity. It needs some improvement, but a lot of it is just improving student communication....

Comment:Parent:The Linden STEAM Academy has a creative program. The school offers engineering design classes to students grade k-8, and some project-based learning in the regular education classes. The building and campus are airy and sunny, and the green campus has a live grass soccer field, a concrete plaza, basketball court, school garden, and a nice playground. Some of the teachers are really wonderful, smart, creative and caring. We loved Mrs. Yau for K, Mrs. Hannifran for 1st, Mrs. Smith for 3rd. Ms. Rosenthal for science in 5th, 6th grade, and both STEM class teachers. Since the school is large, you can ask for your child to be assigned to a particular teacher you think s/he would work well with. The student body is diverse and the parents are friendly.  Like all of Malden’s public schools, the classrooms are getting a bit crowded as class sizes grow to big for the design of the building. The administration has turned over recently, so I hope what is good about the school continues....
Comment:Senior:It was good that students need to Unionize. As well the teachers were very nice and as well the band is pretty good....

Comment:Junior:My two year experience here at New Mission high was pretty lowkey, and laidback because that's the vibe I made sure my time there gave off. You are the vibe you give off in that school, take this small information and run with it ....

Comment:Junior:I moved to Plymouth in 2018 and started attending Rising Tide my freshman year in 2021. I was scared, as all of my friends had gone to North high school.  I was taking a big step going to a school where I knew nobody. But I knew that I wanted to be a part of a community that was close knit. I didn’t want to be in a class with a bunch of kids where I barely knew my teachers. So I took a chance on a school everyone told me I would hate. “Its too hard” they’d say or  “ you’ll hate it there” That’s not to say I didn’t have my share of challenges but with the support of my teachers and new friends I was able to face them head on. And today I’m proud to say that I will be going on to my fourth and final year at Rising Tide happy with the choice I made. And that’s all because I took a chance on a small school despite what everyone else told me....

Comment:Alum:Wareham Senior High School is a very small school population wise that does the best it can with a relatively moderate amount of resources and staff at their disposal. Of course, not all of their teachers and staff are perfect, but the parents and staff are generally very involved due to the small size of the school and so students often feel seen at all times. That being said, there can still be improvements made in the quality of classes, specifically course material, and much of this comes from many of the challenges that all public schools face regarding standardized testing and material....

Comment:Alum:I had a great experience as a student during my four years of high school. I am completely satisfied with my experiences and education and believe no significant changes or improvements are necessary. I am thoroughly content with the way the school has conducted its educational practices and fostered a nurturing environment for learning. German, Economics, and Practical Law are three of my favorite courses in high school. They offered a blend of theoretical knowledge and practical application that has been invaluable for my overall growth. Furthermore, these subjects have sparked interests that I plan to explore further in my future academic pursuits....

Comment:Senior:Overall, Bridgewater Raynham Regional High School is a very inclusive school. We offer various sports for both boys and girls, great academic opportunities, clubs, and after-school activities. We all participate in volunteering and are required to complete 60 hours of community service in order to graduate. The classrooms are decently sized and are equipped with new technology (smart boards). Our food is not the best, but it is free for every student....

Comment:Sophomore:It has a very nice Advanced work class and controlled school environment. Extracurricular classes are engaging as well as academic classes. All teachers are invested in students and are willing to help individuals. The environment is generally clean with minimal trash...

Comment:Parent:i love the school . my 2 older boys went there and they loved it and had no problem and when my younger son was struggling with reading they were there for him every step of the way .my 5 yr old daughter goes nowand is loving it and her teachers.the school always has shows and events that involve families and for thankgiving the have a feast and for the end of school year they have a school bbq and a dj its an awesome school and would recommend it to any parent.....

Comment:Senior:Lynn English has been an excellent school for me to receive amazing education. Not only that, Lynn English has been the absolute reason that now I have such amazing friends from 9th to my Senior year and more years to come. I’m grateful to have amazing experiences from teachers and staff alike! This will be a great core memory of mine!...

Comment:Senior:As a senior at East Boston High School, my overall experience has been incredibly rewarding and transformative. From challenging academic courses to engaging extracurricular activities, I've had the opportunity to explore my interests, develop my skills, and prepare for life after graduation. The support and guidance from teachers, counselors, and peers have been invaluable in navigating the college application process and planning for my future. From memorable senior traditions to meaningful community service initiatives, I've cherished every moment of my senior year and feel prepared to embark on the next chapter of my journey. East Boston High School has truly provided me with a solid foundation for success, both academically and personally....

Comment:Middle School Student:Gardner Middle School was the ideal school if a person is into sports. They are well known to be one of the most competitive middle schools in their chorus, band, and sports programs. The chorus and band learnt classic music and did competitions between other schools to earn medals. The band class also had an amassing band march during the football game at the High School. There were many connections and opportunities presented to the students that went to Gardner Middle School. The academics challenged everyone to the best of their abilities. If anyone fell behind there was tutoring and after-school service to help them. There are multiple clubs after-school to get the students involved in other activities that they might want to try. Teachers and faculty were friendly and helpful towards their students, parents, guardians, and outside visitors. Overall it's an engaging environment for the student to flourish academically and socially....

Comment:Senior:In highschool as the years go on you realize how life changes and how real life is. I think my high school experience was very different ! I switched to a different shop 2 years in and it completed change alot of things for me. From realizing you really had to do it on your own to really being in a better place! I was always alone but I was very involved , from being vice president of my class to doing high school tours and being a high honor student. I definetly think I made my mark and accomplished everything I wanted to do. Throughout all of my trials and tribulations I met some great teachers that helped me get to where i am at !  Highschool is definetly not for the weak but i am proud to say i used all of my resources and took advantage of everything offered to me and went above and beyond. Im happy to say im happy to be ending such a rollercoaster and growing and continuing on to another chapter !...
Comment:Alum:There are really good teachers at Conte and I personally found friends easily there. They are really strong in ELA/
Comment:Senior:I love CASH and the vibe that people bring and the activities and the teacher, it’s very easy to make friends here and the teachers are awesome....

Comment:Senior:My personal experience at Athol High School was decent. I found teachers that I liked and personally grew close to them. They helped my high school experience grow as they were there to help, support, and make me happy. My friends were also a big part of my high school experience. My school was decent at doing fun activities during the year. My friends made these events become the best times and I will always have memories of them. I was also very lucky to be able to start taking college classes my junior year, and then go to a college to take classes on the campus. This definitely is getting me ready for college, which the classes at my high school failed to do. However, the students at the school make the school struggle and look bad. The students trash the bathroom, causing rules that people don’t agree with. They also start fights which make people feel unsafe. If the school actually disciplined the students instead of being afraid of them, the school would be in better shape....
Comment:Parent:Wonderful school  the teachers are all great my son when there from the time bridge was open he will be the first  graduating  class of 2020...
Comment:Niche User:i enjoyed doing my classes online because it was flexible. My high school allowed me to finish school and earn my diploma and encouraged me every step of the way!...

Comment:Parent:Practically a brand new facility with great space and fun outdoor play structures.  But the teachers, administrators and staff are truly incredible and what make it special.  They have gone above and beyond in a challenging year to make school the same safe and inviting place it has always been for our first grader.  The teachers provide individual attention and the school is inviting and accessible.  The administration listens to feedback from parents and is transparent with information.  Feels a bit odd to review a school, but if I could give it six stars I would!...
Comment:Parent:Great School - My daughter loves it here and finds the class size to be perfect. It is a wonderful town and a great facility....

Comment:Parent:Our introduction to PVCA began when my son was approaching kindergarten age. We wanted to find the best fit for our family, and we found it at PVCA. From the first time we walked through the doors, and every single time since, we have been welcomed with open arms by everyone - staff, faculty, students, parents. I especially like that it feels like a family. For my only child, that is especially important - that he have role models who are an extension of our family at home. My child has grown and bloomed in every way, thriving in this environment where the teachers truly love and care for each student. Before the school year even began we got a letter from the teacher saying that she was praying for our children and that their year in her classroom would be blessed. The curriculum is top notch and the environment is so positive and encouraging. The opportunities for learning within the classroom and beyond are amazing. PVCA is unique and special and we are grateful every day for it....
Comment:Niche User:The teachers are amazing. The students are very kind and the things that are taught are very useful....

Comment:Niche User:Outstanding school!  Offers incredible learning opportunities for students including a Gr. 3 & 4 Leadership Academy where students develop leadership skills while volunteering in K-2 classrooms during select recess periods.   Simply amazing!...

Comment:Middle school student:Tucker was really good, all the teachers are nice, the food is good, and safety and learning are the main priorities. It is really diverse, and way  more diverse than others. The after school activites are fun, and there is even garden club and green team, where you learn about the invironment....

Comment:Middle school student:Overall, a good school. Don't have a problem with the front office or most of the staff members. Many of the teachers are really good. There were many math opportunities for me, both in school and with the clubs. I feel sometimes like my mental health issues are undermined and that I need a better outlet for when I feel lonely, pondering how our school could insert a support group into the curriculum for at least outside activities. Comment:Middle school student:As a sixth grade student, LES has been a great choice. All of the teachers are friendly and kind and are always willing to help you. Comment:Parent:Riverbend is an absolute gem, and I am so grateful that my kids get to be a part of this amazing community.  True to Montessori principles, students learn in multi-age classrooms -- stretching the younger students and giving the older students opportunities to be authentic mentors. My kids have built multi-year relationships with teachers who truly know them as learners and as people. Rather than sitting at desks and moving through the curriculum lock-step, students work at tables or on the floor (on workmats) and are giving the opportunity to move at their own pace, under the guidance of well-trained teachers.  They also spend time in nature and working on a farm! The result is high-engagement, high-curiosity, and low-stress. In three years, elementary-age children have not once complained about going to school. In a time of pressurized childhood, this school allows children to be children -- and that's the secret to their students' cognitive, social, and emotional growth....

Comment:Other:The Fessenden School is a private, all-boys day and boarding school located in West Newton, Massachusetts, USA. It serves students from pre-kindergarten through grade nine. The school was founded in 1903 and has a strong focus on providing a well-rounded education that emphasizes academic excellence, character development, and extracurricular involvement. The curriculum includes traditional subjects such as English, mathematics, science, history, and foreign languages, as well as offerings in the arts, athletics, and outdoor education. The Fessenden School is known for its supportive community, dedicated faculty, and commitment to preparing students for success in high school and beyond....

Comment:Parent:We joined Fayerweather for middle school, after both my children attended the local public elementary school. At Fayerweather, the teachers and staff made good on their promise to “know every child.” They are flexible and responsive—truly caring about their students and supporting them as they discover the subjects and issues they are passionate about—offering many opportunities for learning *and* action. The school is strong in its academic, social/emotional, and artistic offerings—and the library and librarians are the heart of the school. We were also impressed with the robust after-school program, including team sports and an after-school band that played at The Burren in Somerville. I have felt welcomed by staff and students in ways that have changed my life. But, as a white student, I have experienced privileges at LHS that non-white students do not have. Though I can say that the staff at Longmeadow High School seem to work hard to advocate against discrimination and racism, not all students feel this way. Comment:Senior:The community here is very accepting, especially when you're switching from schools midway through your high school life, from being at a trade school for Freshmen and Sophomore year, to now a public school for Junior and the end of my Senior year. The teachers here are always advocating in one way or another for a student's needs when it comes to academics. The guidance counselors are also very helpful, and I enjoy the efforts in trying to raise awareness of the music & arts within schools here, something that you do not see often in other places unfortunately. Comment:The only "bad" thing I've experienced is just within the student body; I have definitely heard of drama that goes around but its nothing too serious. Just a lot of kids saying stuff towards each other but problems like this seem to be handled quite effectively because of teachers and the office. Overall, I've enjoyed my time here, and will come back to visit my teachers post-graduation!...

Comment:Niche User:Excellent public school in Newburyport, MA with great teachers and administrative staff.  Self-directed learning and top notch curriculum.  K-8 only and limited after-school activities.  You'll have to enroll your child in town or rec-league activities outside the school....

Comment:Junior:As a student, especially in junior year with the stigma around it being one, and if not the hardest year, I have to say I feel pretty pleased with my classes, teachers, and extra help opportunities. Due to our lunch being divided in 2, along with using my flex learning, students are able to maximize their learning time with seeing teachers outside of class time but still in school hours. Something to consider changing I would have to say is sometimes the lack of adaptability to students needs. I will say I personally have struggled in the past years even with the extra help , maintain a strong sense of my math curriculum. The clubs, and sports the school offers however are brood, and there is something for everyone. The opportunity to express yourself and your interests is endless throughout the school. The only change would have to be the change in teaching and engagement from these teacher and counselor's, especially when students are continuously reaching out....

Comment:Parent:Great satisfaction as parents to have our son in this school. This school has a wonderful principal, loving and understanding teachers, and all the nice staff....

Comment:Senior:Honestly, Barnstable High School is probably on the better end of schools around Cape Cod. On the lowest level is probably DY- but nobody talks about it anymore or not as much as say Falmouth district. Because of this, I'm not too concerned with attending Barnstable. It is simply mediocre. We have had some bad downfalls; fights breaking out, bad teachers, bad food outbreaks etc. Yet at least, my sad, but fairly casual experience, wasn't labeled as one taken at our rivals- DY and Nauset. I liked the opportunities we had, as we were probably the school with the most arts programs, diverse clubs, and creative options regarding electives- but we were totally not stinky and DY. This is why I like not being stinky (like our rivals) and always at loss with Barnstable High's sports teams.  Barnstable is cool I guess....

Comment:Senior:My overall experience at Malden High has been good, I would rate it a 4/5. I transferred in my junior year and the staff and teachers welcomed me, they are overall great faculty members as long as you are a respectable student. The academics are great but if you aren't white or Asian you have to push the idea of AP classes to your guidance counselor, at least that is how it was in my experience and the experience of my peers. The administration is a hit or miss, sometimes they are helpful other times they will go out of their way to make your experience difficult. Sports-wise the school isn't so great, and by that I mean our football team. If our head of athletics funded the other sports we would have a solid overall sports presence but they only care about our really bad football team. The new round of students becomes worse and worse, they have no respect for upperclassmen or teachers and most of their behavior doesn't get reprimanded the way it should be so the disrespect continues....

Comment:Senior:I think north attleboro high school is a fantastic place and it can be even better by bringing more AP options, and better schedules. On top of that, better food could always be welcome....

Comment:Parent:The teachers and children nice, everything is pretty organized. No bullying to date, which is important. Not extremely academically challenging, but not terrible either. Comment:Senior:Four Rivers Charter Public School is a small college preparation school that truly readies its students for life after high school. What it lacks in size, it makes up for in the dedication of each teacher to their student's education....

Comment:Senior:My experience at Beverly High has been excellent. Through virtual, hybrid, and online styles the teachers and faculty have been committed and supportive. Comment:Alum:My overall experience at West Boylston Middle High School was a favorable one. It took a long time to get new nets, yet the football team had a brand new field made for them. A good memory I have at WBMHS is that everyone knew each other (students and faculty). This make school a tight-knit community that I enjoyed....

Comment:Senior:My time spent at Belchertown high school has been a great experience. school_name: Pioneer Valley Performing Arts Charter Public School
review: Comment:Parent:PVPA is an outstanding school for young people interested in the performing arts who are good at handling being responsible for their decisions and actions. However, our student worked very hard, received excellent grades and got into a good college to pursue her artistic education....

Comment:Senior:When I first entered billerica my freshman year I didn't know anyone, but by the end of my first week there I met some of the best people ever! The students and staff were so welcoming to me and made me really appreciate choosing Billerica High. My Junior and Senior year I've had some of the most difficult language teachers yet. At times they made me feel clueless about certain topics which wasn't the best feeling. abbreviation: Essex North Shore Agricultural & Technical School
school_name: Essex North Shore Agricultural & Technical School
review: Comment:Senior:Ultimately, I had a fulfilling experience with Essex Tech. I enjoyed the opportunity to take the Engineering shop class, it was great hands-on experience.  Additionally, through my Engineering shop, I was able to take on a co-op experience at only age 17 at Rochester Electronics in Newburyport, MA. This co-op experience is probably the best part of my high school experience. This educational institution offers numerous sports, including soccer, which I participated in for my four years, becoming a varsity player as just a freshman. I took three APs during my time at this high school, including AP biology, AP U.S. history, and AP calculus. The worst part regarding my experience was probably the lack of AP options, but they did offer them nonetheless. I would suggest adding a few more. Overall, this is a great institution, the administration truly cares about their students and go out of their way to make the school more advanced and work everyday to improve this educational experience....

Comment:Senior:I feel as though the best years throughout my high school career have been those during my shop weeks because i really get to learn and be more hands on because i go to a vocational school, and my worst times were  my freshman year of high school when i had to do online learning due to covid 19 , because during that time i didn't really feel like i was learning to the best of my ability, & during that time my grades were starting to slip because of doing online schooling, what i would like to change at my school would be for seniors to have more senior privileges, because at my school they were taken away due to the last year's senior class, i just wish that they took into accountability and realized that we are different we aren't the same people, and that the school needs to hold people accountable for their actions and not take it out on this year's senior class, because we diverse the opportunities that past graduates received, we should also be able to feel some sense of adulthood...

Comment:Senior:Amazing school, I went here from kindergarten from 3rd grade. I’m now in middle school and miss station avenue. So many of the teachers were awesome like Mrs.Ostrom. Not sure if she’s still a teacher there but she was amazing at teaching, also she was incredibly nice. Would totally send my kids here if i was a parent...

Comment:Senior:Marlborough High School offers a wide variety of AP classes, Varsity Sports and Clubs.  I took advantage of 6 AP Classes, 4 Varsity Sports and 5 Clubs!  My teachers and guidance counselor have all been very supportive of me and encouraged me to take advantage of all of the opportunities within our school.   With all of these activities I was able to build quite a successful network and I feel very prepared to graduate and go on to College.  Comment:Unfortunately my first two years were a little bit tougher before we got split up into college level classes.  We have a lot of kids who do not speak English as a first language and they held back the rest of kids in our classes because the teachers had to teach to their level....

Comment:Senior:Leominster HS epitomizes a community of education and spirited athletic engagement. The pinnacle of our experience is the student involvement in sports, fostering strong sense of school spirit/camaraderie. Football games, baseball & soccer matches pulsate with energy of the crowd, showcasing pride & unity. These experiences instill lessons of resilience, discipline, and teamwork. However, the pandemic had significantly disrupted our high school years, casting a shadow over sports seasons w/ cancellations & restrictions. I envision updates to the school as a vital change. Modernized facilities would elevate the high school experience, reflecting the commitment to excellence and providing a conducive environment for learning, athletics, and extracurriculars. In conclusion, LHS embodies school culture, athletic involvement, and a commitment to excellence. Despite setbacks of COVID, our community remains united in its determination to overcome challenges & cultivate thriving environments....

abbreviation: Joseph R. Dawe Jr. Elementary School
school_name: Joseph R. Dawe Jr. Elementary School
review: Comment:Parent:We have a 2nd-grader and a kindergartener at the Dawe.  Teachers have been awesome.  Incredibly diverse community. Comment:Senior:The principal position was constantly being changed through my high school career. I experienced a series of principals, but I can fairly say that not one treated students unfairly. The teachers are always sweet and never fail to lend help when needed. Comment:Alum:Methuen High is a great place for a high school education. The building is modern and the environment is great. Comment:Senior:I dont regret coming to KIPP. However, sticking with this high school brought so many opportunities, and friendships I will forever be grateful. I believe KIPP's motive to always try to improve is very admirable, and though I believe there's much that needs to be improve, the school overall is very safe and resourceful. I appreciate the staffs efforts to have a relationship with their students (professionally ofc.) and appreciate the teachers different approaches to teaching. I do think the school could do better with their arts and liberal programs, as they seem to be lacking in resources. However, being a STEM person, I believe the improvements to gather opportunities for students to explore STEM has been made but I would appreciate more exposure to different fields career/education wise....

Comment:Senior:Montachusett Regional Vocational Technical High School (Monty Tech) has provided me with a strong foundation as I graduate and pursue an Undergraduate Education. Providing me with practical experience in my field, as well as great relationships and resources to help me grow academically and as an individual and leader within the school community. The ability to get involved with topics that I am passionate about,  including mental health awareness, and community service helped me to meet and collaborate with new and different types of people. In the future, there should be more focus on student involvement, as many students come from different surrounding towns and communities, and providing emphasis on involvement within the school community will enhance student's high school experience at Monty Tech academically as well as socially, helping them to build skills of collaboration, helping them to feel confident in themselves and be involved with future communities....

Comment:Senior:South High has wonderful teachers, some of which I believe I will keep in touch with once I graduate.  Many of the administrators are also wonderful. Comment:Parent:Great community feel and enthusiastic staff.  I can't speak to the other teachers, but it's our first year and I haven't been happy with my child's 504 plan not being followed....

Comment:Senior:Revere High School hasn't been a terrible experience. When it comes to the worst parts would have to be the many safety concerns and very little support for college at times. Comment:Senior:Global Learning Charter Public School is an admirable school overall. There are only 500 students who go from middle school all the way to high school. The teacher-to-student ratio is crucial, and this school ratio is excellent since it's a small school. All the staff is friendly and creates a warm family atmosphere for the students. I have met some of the best teachers in the school, who motivated me to pursue higher education. They also provide rigorous learning for the students by now offering freshman high schoolers the opportunity to graduate with their associate's degree. The only downside is the lack of sports; they don't offer sports such as basketball, soccer, baseball, cheering, etc. They also don't host significant events like pep rallies; instead, they do a student-teacher volleyball game. The food is also not the best; some days are good, but they're rare. Since it's a charter school, the students are required to wear uniforms, a navy or burgundy color with khakis pants....

Pathfinder does have extracurricular activities that may not be as competitive as some other local schools, but I think they have more options for things like drama club, and inclusive activities than other school options. The school resources available at Pathfinder have been much better than my old high school. Overall I enjoy Pathfinder Tech, but I would like if they had more options for transportation after school....

abbreviation: Edward M. Kennedy Academy for Health Careers
school_name: Edward M. Kennedy Academy for Health Careers
review: Comment:Senior:Edward M. Kennedy Academy for Health Careers (EMK) is a high school that is great if you are interested in health careers, specifically nursing and EMT. EMK provides CNA and EMT classes to students and prepares them for the certification exam. Some teachers are really focused on having their students learn while others (few) give a lot of flexibility and “useful” time which some students use it correctly and others do not. Regarding food, the food is packed lunches and sometimes the vegetables are overcooked. The portion is not a lot and the food tends to be really oily. The building of the grades 11 and 12 is really small. It doesn’t have a library or a gym, we have to use the YMCA across the street. However, in the years ahead, EMK is planning to get its own building and double in size. It is also planning to increase career pathways....

review: Comment:Senior:Whittier tech is not a traditional high school. Also in my years at WSHS I’ve always been big on athletics and have joined the track, basketball, and football teams. While playing I’ve noticed that the school spirit at WSHS is strong. The students  eagerly show their support for our teams by showing up to every game, cheering in the stands. In time I’ve grown to have strong connections with both my teammates and our coaching staff. Furthermore on the academic side I’d argue that our teachers challenge and push us to succeed. Notably so, WSHS has access to a number of AP classes, clubs and extracurricular activities to fit the needs of all students interests....

Comment:Parent:The fact that I know anything that happens good or bad with my children. The staff is amazing. So many wonderful ready to help teachers, aides etc. They have helped my boys love the idea of learning....

Comment:Alum:During my time of being a student at the Conservatory, I have gotten to meet so many different and colorful personalities that have made strong impacts on my daily life. I would not have met some of my greatest and closest friends while learning if I had not chose to stay at the Conservatory. Learning many skills and passions added to the bonus of the curriculum kept my mind always focused and engaged. There were many opportunities given to me by the school that I could better use in my now adult life such as volunteer work, teaching assistant, and even dual enrollment. That is not to say that there are not to be changes like how they advocate for trans and non binary students but do not have appropriate restrooms, those students are forced to go to the nurse to still feel comfortable in there bodies while relieving themselves. Another thing is the lack of security, not to say that the school is unsafe but that there was only one security guard on duty and lots of locked doors....

Comment:Senior:The school is entirely hit or miss. A lot of the teachers that have been employed here for an extended time are highly qualified and really good people. There are a lot of great teachers, don’t get me wrong, but I do have to say they aren’t very selective when it comes to hiring newer faculty. Since the admin turnover I’ve seen a lot more student involvement in decision making. The student council is highly regarded amongst school committees, they do value students opinions. The student body is incredibly diverse, but also very, very small. You’ll generally know just about everyone in your grade at any given time. I could probably tell you everyone’s middle names. There aren’t a huge selection of AP classes, and we don’t offer IB. Also, we offer dual enrollment but it’s not at all advertised. I didn’t find out about it until recently. We have a few clubs to choose from, and overall okay sports....
