school_name: Bay Path Regional Vocational Technical High School
review: Comment:Senior:Going to Bay Path has been a positive experience for me. The shop teachers are amazing and always willing to help their students succeed no matter what field they pursue. The academic teachers are great too....

Comment:Niche User:a wonderful neighborhood school, in which the building is bigger than it appears when you ride by.   It is in a quite neighborhood setting not far from home.  Looking forward to this being a positive school experience....

Comment:Works Here:Cathedral High School provides rigorous, holistic education for Boston-area students. Cathedral is the best value for a Catholic, private education in the Boston area. No student is turned away due to the ability to pay. Cathedral scholars experience proven academic growth despite local and national trends of learning loss and academic declines. 100% of Cathedral seniors are accepted into college. Recent college acceptances include Boston College, Northeastern University, Howard University, Louisiana State University - and so many more. Not only do Cathedral scholars get accepted into college - they often get accepted with life-changing scholarships and financial aid packages. Cathedral is truly a diverse, welcoming community. Our faculty and staff are dedicated to the success of our scholars - academically and personally. Upon graduation, Cathedral scholars are leadership ready, college ready, and life ready....

Comment:Senior:I have spent all my 4 years at this school. I have had great memories and some bad. Overall Whitman Hanson is a great school to go to and will have everything you need or want to do....

Comment:Senior:The school is overall nice, with very good teachers in all departments.  Oakmont is well kept and the teachers really bond with and care about their students. All the departments in the school have good teachers that make learning easy, and fun. The only criticism I have for Oakmont is the math department, as some teachers have trouble following curriculum in the department, and there has been a lot of turnover in the department in my time at Oakmont....
Comment:Parent:I have three children who attend BEEBE School, and we love it! Our experience with teachers have been amazing!...

Comment:Parent:My child was very welcomed and felt a part of the Altavesta family, spent all 6 years and graduated to Kennedy middle where again was met with acceptance. The teachers were great and involved in their responsibilities. Am happy that my second kid is now going there...

Comment:Senior:I loved high school. I felt like a very included individual, but that could also be my outgoing personality. i feel as all the teachers and staff have made a big change in my learning skill to have me become stronger in my learning and in my confidence. As a student with a learning disability, i feel they have made a big impact on my schooling. To be part of a classroom and learning normal maternal and not feel singled out or made feel "different" because i have a harder time understanding the materials in learning. I think that through my Agawam high school career i have made many memories with amazing friends.  My lacrosse team is one of my biggest things i will take with me out of high school, i'm so happy and glad that i went to a high school where i gave me the experience to play the sport i love and to be apart of a team. So id say Agawam high school is a good environment and a good school to spend 4 years of learning....
Comment:Senior:Over all. It’s been a well experience. But there’s been a lot of things going on. Which hasn’t affected me but still ....
Comment:Middle School Student:Very fond memories! It was a while ago, but many of my childhood memories spawn from this school and the friendships that I made....
Comment:Parent:Great school!  Excellent teachers and principal.  Supportive of students and always looking to improve.  Great parent volunteers that bring extra activities....

Comment:Senior:I believe that there are many improvements that can be made to help ready students who are heading to college. Westport has many great resources and opportunities for their students but only a select few are able to get them. Although some are able to receive more than others every student is able to get some type of resources to help them succeed....

Comment:Senior:At greenfield highschool, there was always something to do, a new class to take, or new food items to try in the cafe. There’s a lot of sport programs and clubs for almost any interest and the best part about it is that anyone can join!...

Comment:Junior:The school is fairly decent, though complaints would be the food quality and the school doesn't give enough emphasis and help to students for college. Making the student truly know that what they do in highschool is crucial for future success especially in college....
Comment:Niche User:Great sense of community. Parents are actively engaged positively. Happy spirit....

Comment:Parent:Great school that prepares students for high school. This should be the priority of the benchmarks of schools. The principal and vice principal are amazing with communication. Parents and Teachers are very involved in the system which is great. The curriculum gives everyone a fair chance to succeed and place all students appropriately. The math department can use a little boost - especially 7th grade. Overall a great school to attend....
Comment:Middle school student:very fun school and I never had any problems and all the staff are amazing, every teacher I have met was kind and I love this school...

Comment:Senior:Its a great diverse school that offers several specific courses of study, you can choose from many of their STEM pathways in Computer Science, Engineering and Biomedical Science. The facilities are clean and surveilled so it proides a sense of safety as well....

Comment:Senior:I cannot imagine going to a different school. Every school has their pros and cons but I really feel that at Littleton High School I was given the opportunity to pick my type of learning when it came to learning classes outside of the required classes....
Comment:Niche User:I love the admission office they are all very helpful and professional ! Everything about the location is great. I would recommend this school to anyone I know for sure!...

Comment:Parent:My daughter is in Kindergarten and coming from an inner city school with an awful rating (and well deserved) to Groton was amazing!  The teachers communicate with the parents almost daily.  Everyone from the superintends office down to the school admin is wonderful and has been beyond helpful with our move.  Extremely pleased and happy to be part of the FloRo community....

Comment:Sophomore:I have had a good run at MERHS. The sports are amazing and the school spirit is unmatched. The prom events are really fun and senior activities as well. We have great teachers but very low diversity...

Comment:Junior:Northampton Highschool has a incredible theater and music program, with several related after school clubs and production running each year, as well as a array of science courses, math courses, and electives to choose from. However, NHS's biggest problems are its bare bones arts program and newfound lack of funding. Due to these issues its possible NHS will be letting go of at least five faculty members, increasing our class numbers to about 30-35 students to a teacher, and will eliminate several electives....

abbreviation: Pioneer Charter School of Science II (Pcss-II)
school_name: Pioneer Charter School of Science II (Pcss-II)
review: Comment:Parent:My son likes the small size of the school: He says he feels like he knows everyone. The teachers and counsellors are friendly and willing to talk with parents about what works with their students. I think the small size of the school means they have fewer students to think about and this helps them not be spread too thin compared to bigger schools. The academic work is generally rigorous and the school is very focussed on college preparation. They start taking practice PSATs in like 7th grade or something, so by the time it counts they don't stress about it. If students want to accelerate their path in math, they can take self-guided courses over the summer, and pass an exam, but they have to be very independent learners to do this. They offer AP classes. I wish they had more science-informed practices around the school and more clubs and activities after school around science to live up to their name. One good thing is sometimes they have a class trip ice skating or roller skating....

Comment:Parent:Overall teachers are well qualified and connected with parents. Improvements in automations and electronic tools will be something to consider, as the curriculum for Spanish as second language....

abbreviation: Benjamin Franklin Classical Charter Public School
school_name: Benjamin Franklin Classical Charter Public School
review: Comment:Parent:The teachers from day school to aftercare have supported my child’s learning. The administration is dedicated and knowledgeable. The school culture is welcoming, fun, and based on strong values that are celebrated throughout the year. What I love most of all is the cultural diversity....

Comment:Middle School Student:There are some good teachers, but it's like winning the lottery if you get a good one, it rarely happens. The food here is the same as the teachers, there are some good foods and some horrible foods, but at least the lunch staff are very nice. There are a variety of clubs and after-school activities, so there is something for everyone. The music program is very good. It has very nice, fun, and awesome teachers (Ms. L-A). Curtis respects all religions and races, and there is no school on religious holidays, which the nearby towns do not do. The sports program is great, they provide uniforms and transportation, so you only pay a small fee to join. They are very worried about kid's safety at Curtis....

Comment:Senior:Doherty Middle School was filled with great teachers that encouraged creativity and problem-solving in their students. Teamwork was a characteristic that was highly valued no matter what teachers you were assigned to. There was always something for everyone, whether you were an athlete or a theatre kid....

Comment:Senior:Attending North Quincy High School all four years of my high school career have been some of the best of my life. I wake up going to school feeling excited because the school has such a welcoming environment. The staff are there for you always, the academics are amazing. Over the past four years, I have taken in knowledge that I will use for the rest of my life. We have a plethora of clubs and sports for every single person. The faculty at North make you feel like you are their number 1 priority and are always there for you. I am very grateful for my four years attending and wouldn’t trade it for anything....

Comment:Senior:I think that Groton Dunstable has great academics and offers some interesting courses. My experience has been enjoyable and the school spirit is pretty high! However, there is very little diversity and often we see vandalism and even hate speech. But overall, the school is pretty safe and welcoming, and I have had great experiences in clubs and other activities....

Comment:Freshman:I'm writing this as someone who's been attending this school for many  years.Comment:Pros: The student community here is great! Most kids are very friendly and responsible, making them good people to be around. I find that it's sort of "normal" to be have straight A's here and be enrolled in Honors or AP classes, as most kids here do very well academically.  There is a wide variety of athletic teams, some of them being co-op with other neighboring schools. The facilities, such as the auditorium, weight room, gymnasiums, and science labs, are very nice! These facilities and other equipment in the school makes it possible to take electives not usually offered at other schools.Comment:Cons: Some of the teachers are inexperienced and often teach things we have already learned years past. Sometimes the school seems a little too small and cramped (though it makes it easy to get to classes on time). While not a ton of bullying takes place, when it does happen, the faculty doesn't do a lot about it....

Comment:Parent:The teachers are excellent and they really care about the success of each student.Comment:The children there are not very nice for the most part.  We moved from California to Massachusetts before the beginning of the school year.  My twin boys make friends very easily, but had a very rough time at this school.  I do not now if it is just "middle school" and kids change, but most kids seemed to be "bratty" and there were "cliques" and were not open to making new friends.  Most kids were spoiled with so many having cellphones (in the 5th grade, for no reason other than to play games & text AND the school really doesn't want the students to have cellphones)....
Comment:Middle School Student:I am in 8th grade right now and this is the third school I've gone to and it is the best school. The teachers are really nice and everyone is welcoming....

Comment:Parent:An absolutely superb school.  Our little girl came to Pine Hill in 1st grade, and has now matriculated to Dover-Sherborn Middle School.  The special part about Pine Hill is that the teachers, and staff have immense talent, and care greatly about the students.  I watched my little girl grow, blossom, and become the best young woman she can be.  Pine Hill encouraged her to be curious, lead, engage, and to think larger.  I could not fathom a better education for her at any price....
Comment:Freshman:I like the staff especially the social workers because so I could have someone to talk to when I'm feeling down or angry or not myself...

abbreviation: Young Achievers Science & Math Pilot School
school_name: Young Achievers Science & Math Pilot School
review: Comment:Parent:My daughter attends Young Achievers Math & Science Pilot School and I ABSOLUTELY  LOVE this school!!! She has been there for two years now from grade 2-3, before deciding on this specific school for her out for four others I heard from afew friends and strangers that it has ALWAYS been a great school!!! There used to be a waiting list for peoples kids to get into this school and most people couldn’t or never did get their child into this school!! I like how there is TWO teachers in a class with ONLY 18-20 students, they are very productive in teaching , the school is very structured has Percs like Dance class for my daughter whom LOVES to dance and I can’t afford to put her into a dance school/classes SO having dance AT school is a big plus ! Her teachers are ALWAYS awesome, SHE loves the school too I am just very pleased with the school overall. I would give it 5 Stars but I don’t think ANY school is 100% PERFECT and that’s OK but they ARE an awesome school hands down! -Niasia Rivera...
Comment:Middle School Student:I liked how we were divided by clusters because it allowed the teachers to help us with our school work on a personal level....
Comment:Niche User:I enjoyed every year of it....

Comment:Alum:My time at CHS during high school was an experience. I must admit, I didn't fully appreciate the strong sense of community and the predominant representation of black and brown students back then. I now find myself reminiscing about those connections as I am attending a predominantly white college. It's at this point that I truly value the efforts of most teachers who genuinely strived to enhance our school experience to the best of their ability and the limited resources a city like Chelsea was able to provide! As time passed, I found my stride, and by senior year, I experienced a new sense of fun and fulfillment in many aspects of school life. This realization serves as a reminder that growth and memorable experiences often come from stepping outside of one's comfort zone, something I hope to work on in college to make the best out of my social life and taking care of myself. I appreciate my high school---with all its ups and downs....
Comment:Alum:I loved going here! It's a very welcoming environment, and the teachers really care about their students, unlike other high schools....

Comment:Alum:Walsh was great when I was there. The teachers were nice, everyone was attentive, the only bad thing was probably the students. At times I felt like my fellow classmates were always jerks but besides that, there was nothing wrong with the school. 10/10, would go again in another life....

Comment:Parent:I have 2 children in the dual Language program, with my oldest being in the program since inception. I am very impressed with the teacher’s ability to combine and proficiently teach our kids from Kindergarten on. The teachers from Kindergarten to 3rd grade are amazing and I am proud to be a part of this program....
Comment:Alum:Some of the best parts of once being a student at Ayers was how they taught us to be good people and accept differences....

Comment:Parent:Georgetown's spirit is absolutely amazing! The community here is so supportive and enthusiastic. Whether it's at school events, sports games, or community gatherings, you can feel the energy and pride that everyone has for their town. The spirit at Georgetown is contagious, and it brings people together in such a special way. It's a place where people genuinely care about one another and come together to celebrate and support each other. The community's spirit is truly something to be proud of!...

Comment:Senior:I go to the Shawsheen tech and have been for all four years of my high school experience. I really love going to this school and I think that it has given me amazing opportunities. Since it is a vocational high school I get to go out and work every other week at a pediatric office, this allows me to see what it could be like to go into the medical field. Which is what I want to do with my life. Then there is academics only every other week and as a student I really like this schedule. I think the Shawsheen tech is a great school where I learn a lot of important things about myself and what I would like to do when I leave here....

Comment:Parent:I love this school in comparison to Higgins in peabody. The teachers seem to go above the average in this state. My son is now in the seventh grade and although he's smaller than most other students he's yet to complain about being bullied. Great new school....

Comment:Alum:I received a well rounded education from highly motivated, intelligent teachers who truly knew their subjects. A racially diverse environment, administrative and student population wise....

Comment:Senior:My experience at Abington High School has been amazing overall. Every teacher there looks for the best in every student! I’ve loved all my classes I took and I’m so thankful for the school! Everyone in guidance has been helpful and is totally understanding and kind! I’m so thankful to have gone to a new school with awesome staff and students!...
Comment:Senior:I like Hopkins because of the closeness of each person in the school, everyone knows everyone. I do wish that the lunch was better than it is, but not much else I dislike....
Comment:Niche User:I think the administration goes above and beyond for the students....

Comment:Parent:We feel incredibly lucky to have our 3-year-old daughter enrolled in the KO program of the Dante Alighieri Montessori School. It is a unique learning environment that encourages independence, creativity, and most importantly respect for self and others. Since September, our daughter has cultivated an incredible sense of community responsibility and discovered a newfound curiosity for the world and people around her. These aren't often things you say about a 3-year-old, but I attribute much of this to her new school and teachers. She now finds joy and pride in completing tasks on her own, but also knows she can ask for help from her older peers if needed. It truly is a school community. Every morning, she asks if it's a school day...when we answer yes, she responds with, "Yippie!"...

Comment:Senior:Attleboro Highschool is a diverse school with many opportunities in their CTE programs. I am a part of the Culinary Arts program and I have received a great education on culinary both in cooking and pastry arts. My four years at the school have been great, I have had no problems with administration and classes were informing and were relatively easy to learn. I have formed great and long lasting friendships at the school. There is a large population of athletes at the school, and Attleboro's team spirit is high. Many students are supportive and helpful. Teachers are always willing to help students and offer after school sessions. I am happy and satisfied with my experience at the high school, and wouldn't change it for anything....

abbreviation: Abby Kelley Foster Charter Public School
school_name: Abby Kelley Foster Charter Public School
review: Comment:Senior:I think that Abby Kelley is overall a great school. There are many perks of the school academically, as that is its primary focus, but I think it would benefit from having more funding to allow guides to delve into a wider assortment of classes. I do believe that the athletics at the school are not the greatest and they could be better, but they are overall pretty good considering the school is primary focused on academics. Also, as a Ghanaian, it feels very easy to connect with others at the school since that is the primary ethic makeup. Overall, I think the school is pretty good....
Comment:Parent:The teacher to student ratio is lower than other schools. Class offerings are great for this level. Good parent community....

Comment:Alum:My experience at Gloucester High School was one I wouldn’t trade despite the challenges that I faced being there. As a successful black student, many of the racial issues that took place at the school were left to me to handle. Because of the lack of ethnic diversity within the teacher population, black students and students of color are often misunderstood and underrepresented. The best part of my experience was being apart of the community, especially through sports. Although the school has its flaws (particularly in the administrative system), there is an awesome sense of community. I would like to see more teachers who represent the student body....
Comment:Sophomore:I remember in 8th grade, two fights broke out within the first three days of school. They both happened right next to me....

Comment:Alum:I attended this school for the first 3 years of middle school (2014-2017) and I loved it! The teachers were very kind and easy to talk to. Even to today, I can remember their names because they had left such an impression on me. The school also reaches out to have a lot of afterschool activities, book sales, and guests come to speak to the children. I highly recommend this school....

Comment:Senior:I transferred to Braintree High for my senior year just this past fall. My last year of high school happened to be my first year ever at public school, as I've only attended private Catholic schools before that. My mental health was the main factor that caused me to transfer, plus the lack of preparation, organization, and support at my old high school. Going to public school daunted me because I'm very introverted. The bigger student body made me feel intimidated, especially as a rising senior about to enter an entirely new setting. But Braintree immediately made me feel like I belonged. Although the population is not the most diverse, it's definitely much more diverse than what I've been used to my whole life, which made me feel relieved and gave me hope that I really could fit in. The faculty is so dedicated, supportive, and engaged, and I can say the exact same for the students. Here, I feel like I can finally be heard, understood, and cared for both academically and individually....
Comment:Alum:I enjoyed my time at the Ditson Elementary with caring and compassionate teachers who worked hard to be sure I learned everything I needed to be college ready!...

Comment:Parent:Teachers are very invested in the students and support parent concerns. I have two children, one on an IEP and one on a 504, and have felt supported through the entire elementary school time. Virtual learning during the pandemic exceeded expectations, and children have social-emotional classes to talk about how to handle difficult situations they encounter. The PTA goes above and beyond to try to do activities to make both teachers and families feel appreciated....

Comment:Senior:I have went to his school and I loved it!! Best teachers ever and everyone know I loved it too! Great academics and they have the best sports and coaches! Food is iffy but just bring your own lunch. Everyone always encourages you to do your best! I would totally recommend this school for anyone who lives in the area....

Comment:Junior:Seekonk High School is a great school with an excellent program of studies including a wide variety of subjects. The only thing is that it is difficult to advance academically and choose your own classes if you make mistakes with your schedule as an underclassman. For example, if you don't take Honors Biology you will never be able to take an advanced course like AP Physics, AP Biology, or AP Environmental Science unless you either double up one year or drop a full year course like Band or a Foreign Language. This is because there are requirements like taking three years of gym which, although I understand, seems redundant for four-year athletes (which there are many of). This is the same case for math courses, as you will never reach AP Calc if you weren't immersed in the compacted math curriculum in middle school. Otherwise, there are many opportunities for students to get involved in club life or even make their own clubs, which is a great way to gain leadership experience....

Comment:Parent:Great Principal, organized and academics driven. Teachers go beyond expectations, helped our kids after school.  They did get a solid foundation and are achieving great at private Highschools, beyond expectations......
Comment:Middle school student:Very great school. I went here 3 years ago. The teachers are very welcoming and overall a very great community....
Comment:Parent:My child has thrived at this school! The teachers and staff are so loving and attentive. They really take the time to get to know their students and how they can help them excel....

Comment:Parent:I honestly can’t say enough about St. Joseph School in Wakefield. I have sons in 6th grade and 7th grade. The small class sizes allow for individualized attention. This school has some of the most creative, unique, caring teachers that I’ve ever encountered. The 5th grade teacher does a lot of project based learning that encompasses research, writing, presentations, creating a model (ex. a Mayan temple), and learning culturally relevant songs. The creative writing program is second to none. It is excellent preparation for their rigorous middle school program that will prepare them well for any high quality private or public high school. Our students are known for their comfort in public speaking; they get a lot of practice.  Comment: The small class sizes also allow the teachers to stay on top of monitoring social media etc. that our middle schoolers may be on. They are positioned well to make sure our kids navigate these waters safely and appropriately.  St. Joseph School is a gem!...

Comment:Parent:Our son was excelling in our highly-ranked public school but wanted something more which we found at Fenn. The transition for 5th Grade last year exceeded our (high) expectations, not only from the deep engagement of the faculty and staff but also from the students' own participation in their experience. Fenn was the right choice for us because the community is uniquely skilled in understanding the needs of boys in this formative time of their lives; it shows in the ways they curate opportunities for students to take ownership of their  journeys, from studies to sports/clubs/music/etc. Boys have a real opportunity to thrive at Fenn, discovering who they are in a safe and supportive environment. We are a biracial family and have felt completely at home in Fenn's inclusive community. Our son absolutely loves it and is looking forward to starting Middle School this Fall, which is a testament unto its own!...

Comment:Parent:My kids have been at the school for 4 years, since K3. We frankly came for the convenience, it being so close to our home. But we stayed because we've been so blown away with by everything it has offered our children, and our whole family. It's focus on important values and its strong sense of community is like no other I've seen in the city. I've seen my very shy child truly blossom and grow her self confidence, while also thriving academically with a rigorous curriculum (which I've learned is one one of the best in the country) and excellent teachers to support her. The afterschool program is a gift to parents, and it's also a place where they find continued support. One of my favorite parts of afterschool is how they get to interact with kids at every class level, which I have found very beneficial as they develop their social skills.  It's the type of school where you have easy access to teachers and also the principal, whos door is always open. It's truly a special place!...

Comment:Middle school student:We have had two children go through the Park School, one is a rising 8th grader and one is an alum.  They are  very different children/students and have had different Park experiences based on changing leadership over time, but we are very happy at Park!  Our children are both confident (socially and academically) and well-adjusted, and they both show true grit in their learning styles and have been fully supported by the Park teachers and administrators to thrive in their individuality.  We will always be grateful to Park for contributing to the success of our children and, although there has been change, they both have had incredible experiences. We are very grateful to the Park School and the amazing community of teachers, staff and families throughout our time at Park.  We would choose The Park School for our children's foundational education experience again and again!...

Comment:Parent:My 4 year old joined the Waldorf School Nursery program this year. What I wanted for my daughter: to play, get messy, spend most of her day outdoors in nature, play with loose parts and toys made from natural materials, eat nourishing food and be involved in preparing it, have loving and caring teachers that can also hold a boundary and keep her safe, to paint and sing and create, to hear stories, and to be social and learn how to interact with children in a mixed age group. The Waldorf School at Moraine Farm checked all the boxes for us! My daughter has been incredibly happy at this school and we hope to be here as long as we can stay!...

Comment:Parent:Oak Meadow has been an absolutely amazing educational experience for my family for the past two years. My children are young (2 and 4), so it’s my first school encounter as a parent, and I know the bar has been set incredibly high. The children are nurtured and deeply cared for by amazing, highly qualified and empathetic teachers who lead by example. They are genuinely excited to go to school each day, and, through the Montessori teaching method, absorb imperative life, critical thinking, analytical, and social skills in the classroom that they then take home with them. Oak Meadow students (my own and those that I’ve observed of all ages) are independent thinkers who are considerate, respectful, and supportive of one another. It’s so refreshing to witness!Comment:Oak Meadow is a very special learning environment - we looked at many preschools in the area, and are consistently impressed with Oak Meadow’s curriculum, teachers, and community....

Comment:Parent:Birches School provided our grandson with a life-changing education.  As his guardians, we were unhappy with his uninspiring public school, and sought a school that would better stimulate his curiosity and help him establish important skills within a nurturing and caring environment.  Birches was just the place!Comment:The teachers are experienced, and share a deep commitment to progressive, nature based learning that is rigorous and joyful. The academic expectations of students are high, and the students excel. The school is always mindful of the social/emotional needs of children. Being outside every day helps.Comment:After attending Birches, grades 3 through 8, our grandson is attending a large, public high school well prepared to do research, to write and to think in a critical manner.  He has gained self confidence and is well prepared for what lies ahead.  Even as he complains about the testing mania and the stress of high school, he receives very good grades. We highly recommend Birches....

Comment:Parent:My child is only in preschool but is leaps and bounds ahead of many of his peers. Friends Academy inspires kids to ask questions about everyday things, leading to a great understanding. This school is family centric and great at keep you as a parent informed & involved....

Comment:Parent:Hillside is the best decision our family ever made, for the growth of our son. Our son transferred to Hillside from our public school and we will be forever grateful to the staff and admissions team at Hillside for supporting our son academically, socially, and athletically. Our son is a high honor student excelling amazingly in BOTH academics and athletics. He is being heavily recruited for his sport by top schools like Phillips Andover and St. Marks. This amazing opportunity was made possible through the coaching staff and teachers at Hillside. They go above and beyond, believing in our son. He has been rewarded for great behavior, rewarded for his kindness to others, and rewarded for his hard work academically and athletically. It is amazing belonging to a school that supports the future and dreams of our child. Thank you Hillside for all of your help leading our son onto an amazing life path. We will forever be grateful!...

Comment:Middle school student:THIS IS AN AMAZING SCHOOL. I have gone here for a long time and my experience could not have better. This school has amazing programs, fantastic staff, and an overall welcoming and nurturing environment! I highly recommend it....

Comment:Parent:My three children are at Wellan Montessori in lower elementary, upper elementary and voyager (middle school program) respectively. I am most impressed with the way teachers partner with parents to help students thrive. My kids are appropriately challenged academically. Their social emotional and character development are also of equal importance. While the school's physical space is limited because of such amazing location to newton center, the administrators are resourceful in renovating and acquiring more space to use. The students often enjoy walks to fields and make use of train stations to visit museums and landmarks.  Another key character of the school is the emphasis in community service.  Children from young age participate in various community service at school or with their families. There are also great opportunities in sports and arts. As an educator myself I am beyond satisfied with the education my children are receiving....

Comment:Niche User:I worked at Holden Christian Academy for years and noticed how happy the children are there. They enjoy their teachers, the regular worship offered on Mondays, the sense of unity and love among the staff and the general environment. If you can't keep your children home this year and school them in a safer zone,  send them to HCA. The classrooms are small and the interactions are great....

Comment:Parent:My daughter has been a student at Cheverus since Pre school and now, about to enter 3rd grade and I’ve never been more sure that she’s in the best school ! Caring teachers and staff support my daughters to be her best and do her best. Cheverus is more than a just a great education-its part of our family!...

Comment:Niche User:I recommend for families who care about their children Islamic character and practice. Public schools will not teach them Quran, the importance of daily prayers, or gender restrictions when they come of age!...

Comment:Parent:East Boston Central Catholic School is really one of a kind!  My siblings and I graduated from EBCCS and now my children attend the school.  As a parent, I am grateful for the culture of the school, which is one of respect, discipline and faith.  It is not just a school, but a family that we are part of.   As a teacher myself, I'm impressed by the level of academics in every grade.  I feel confident that my children will leave EBCCS with the skills that they need to strive at any high school and college.  I am forever grateful for the school, the amazing staff and the other families who have been a part of our educational journey.  I know I've made a solid investment in my children's futures by sending them to EBCCS!...

Comment:Parent:After multiple years at CRS with our three children I can easily say that every year keeps getting better. Our children continue to love going to school and meet each day with a confidence and curiosity that is unique to CRS. The teachers truly love what they do and engage each of our children in a meaningful way. Our oldest is in the middle school and I cannot not say enough good things about her experience. The academics are excellent and the kids build character and gain confidence in knowing themselves. There is not a large social media presence in the middle school so kids are making real connections through conversations.Comment:There is no such thing as a perfect school, but CRS is wonderful school that balances academics and your child’s well being. The new head of school, Gabe Burnstein has started an exceptional new chapter for CRS and it’s only going to get better!...

Comment:Middle school student:Our daughter has thrived since coming to DCD. The faculty and staff make students feel welcomed and cared for and go out of their way to get to know each child and family. The arts program exposes students to a variety of different media and art forms, from poetry to calligraphy, ceramics to printmaking, and songwriting to woodworking; students have significant options each trimester. Arts and sports at the middle school level are grouped by interest instead of merely grade, further expanding social options for students and building camaraderie and school pride among various peers. Academically, classes are interactive and appropriately challenging and seem to accommodate a variety of different styles of learning. Big enough to have robust programs yet small enough to remain personal, DCD's PK-8 model is very intentional about nurturing children into confident, articulate, interested, and kind young adolescents....

Comment:Parent:Our children went to the early childhood program at this school (nursery and kindergarten) and it was a wonderful experience.  We moved to a different state, otherwise they would still be at this school.  The teachers that our kids had were caring and warm; kids got to do a lot of free play with other children and work on their social skills that way; the program also involved a lot of movement and outdoor time, which is so important to young children.  Even in the short few years that we were there, I could see how being at the school made our kids more creative and gave them great social skills.  We definitely felt like we were a part of the community at this school.  I also liked other aspects of the school experience:  the beautiful building that our kids experienced every day and the real, delicious food at the school's café.  Our kids still miss their old school and I really wish they were still at the Waldorf....

Comment:Alum:I attended Our Lady's Academy from kindergarten up until 8th grade, and I loved my time there as the tight-knit community allowed me to form meaningful friendships. Most of all, I feel that Our Lady's Academy thoroughly prepared me for high school. I found that most of my peers in high school that also attended Our Lady's Academy were much more prepared for the rigor of the curriculum and therefore had an easier transition from middle school to high school. I'm glad that Our Lady's Academy starts standardized testing early on, as it well prepared me for my mid terms and finals in high school. Furthermore, Our Lady's does a good job of implementing the Christian faith into the education. The values that have been implemented into me from Our Lady's Academy have stuck with me and will continue to be an integral part of who I am. Finally, the teachers genuinely care about each and every one of their students and are able to support them in a unique way due to the small class sizes....

Comment:Parent:This is the best Jewish day school around. School is like family. The community is supported and the teachers really care. Students are beyond ready to move up to middle school. Parents are always hanging out after school in the playground, just talking as the kids play cause no one want to leave. I loved it so much that I joined the Board of Trustees as an alumi parent. I just couldn't say goodbye!...

Comment:Parent:Bement is a caring community that strives to meet the academic and emotional needs of each student. Our family appreciates the individualized instruction, small class sizes, and wide range of programming in both athletics and the arts. We feel so lucky that our three children have the opportunity to engage with such an incredible group of educators every day....

Comment:Alum:I am a former St. Agatha School student that was given a quality education, which served as a solid foundation for the rest of my educational years. I am so happy my parents chose to send me here all the way to eighth grade as I made many memories that I still cherish to this day. In addition, I still remain in touch with the friends I made there. Throughout my many years there, not only did I feel safe and comfortable, but also the teachers genuinely cared about you and wanted you to learn. I highly recommend this school!...

Comment:Alum:I attended Brookwood as a student and now, as a parent, my children attend the school.  Brookwood is a unique learning environment in a part of Massachusetts filled with many great public school districts and independent school options.   Brookwood provides students with small class sizes and curricula  at different elementary and middle grade levels that are challenging and broad, ranging from math and reading to arts, music, foreign language, technology, and science.  Academically Brookwood is not a sink or swim classroom environment but challenges students to develop the best in their abilities.  The faculty are extremely committed to the school and the nurturing focus on the individual student that has always been a part of the school's educational tradition.  Brookwood has a strong track record of preparing students for academic success for a lifetime of learning, and I still draw on experiences and learning I gained from the school more than 40 years ago when I was a student....

Comment:Niche User:Truly excellent school experience. Several of the teachers I had left an impression on me that is still with me 30 years later. Teachers were supportive, yet _challenging_. I came from a Goddard schooI and had to step up my game going into MAA. Afterwards I went onto BC High....

Comment:Sophomore:I am currently a sophomore at Hopkinton High School, I would love to say I enjoy being a student at this school but that is not the case. This school is amazing at being a school and a great academic place that I feel really sets students up for success. However, this school lacks spirit, in such examples; I feel as if Hopkinton High School praises their seniors and do not care about the rest of the grades. I understand that it is indeed the senior's last year at HHS, but I do not believe that the administration cares about the other students in grades below. I do wish that this school had some more diversity; but there is nothing that they could do since it is a public education facilityOther than this, I do believe that this school has indeed set me up for success and does indeed want the best for me academically wise....

Comment:Parent:There is simply no place like Montrose.  We have been so pleased with the experience that our two daughters have had at this wonderful school.  The faculty is loaded with smart, gifted, compassionate people who care about the girls and encourage them to be the very best versions of themselves.  The camaraderie among the students is truly unique - these young women are so joyful, funny, engaged, balanced, passionate, faithful, empathetic and kind.  They know they are loved and so they love each other in turn....

Comment:Senior:One of the school's standout qualities is its rigorous academic curriculum, which is designed to challenge and inspire students to reach their full potential. With a focus on critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills, St. John's prepares students not just for college but for lifelong success in an ever-changing world. Beyond academics, St. John's fosters a supportive and inclusive community where students feel valued, respected, and empowered to make a difference. Through a variety of extracurricular activities, service opportunities, and leadership programs, students develop a strong sense of responsibility, empathy, and social consciousness. Moreover, the school's dedicated faculty and staff play a pivotal role in shaping the St. John's experience. With their passion for teaching and unwavering commitment to student success, they serve as mentors, guides, and role models, inspiring students to aim high and pursue their dreams....

Comment:Alum:Choosing to attend a private school is a difficult decision, but Falmouth Academy was well worth every penny. I am a graduate of the class of 2007 and couldn't imagine a better middle school and high school experience.  Academically, FA prepared me extraordinarily well for college - none of my college writing classes were anywhere near as difficult as rhetoric from senior year and the strong science and math classes at FA prepared me extremely well for my future operating nuclear reactors and sonar systems. Comment:More importantly, however, was that FA really let me grow to be comfortable with myself. I came to FA extremely introverted and insecure. FA encouraged my to try programs I'd have never considered before (drama, jazz, soccer, and lacrosse, and latin), and through these programs I grew quite a bit of self confidence and made lifelong friendships.Comment:For any parent and student considering FA, I'd highly encourage you to take a visit and give the school a chance!...

Comment:Senior:My time at Newton South High School was truly enriching. The academic environment was incredibly strong, with challenging courses that pushed me to excel. The teachers were not just educators but mentors who genuinely cared about their students. I remember one instance when my math teacher stayed after hours to help me grasp a complex concept, demonstrating the dedication and kindness that was a consistent theme throughout my experience. The sense of community at Newton South was palpable, and the support from both peers and faculty made it a nurturing place for personal and academic growth...

Comment:Parent:Tabor Academy has been an incredible experience for our daughters and we could not be happier with the school. The campus by the sea is beautiful and safe. The faculty and staff are extremely attentive and supportive, and academics are strong and challenging. Our daughters are varsity sport athletes and the athletic teams are competitive and inclusive. Tabor also has an impressive academic exchange and travel program, allowing one of our daughter to spend her spring break at the Rysensteen Gymnasium in Copenhagen this year! Tabor truly is a special place and we only have positive things to say about this school!...

Comment:Other:The Newman School has been a wonderful, welcoming and delightful experience throughout all the years in the school. Going there has been fun and interesting. Fun because all the people there are kind and welcoming and interesting because I feel I learn so much everyday. I have read the negative reviews and I don’t understand at all. Maybe it has just gotten better in the past years. The staff are always so kind and supportive, the teachers are highly qualified and trained from top colleges. They strive to help us and to incorporate Boston in our learning, though we don’t go out every week in class, we might refer to architecture and go to trips around Boston, for example. The school also offers so many clubs and opportunities, this is how you meet people in other grades! I know almost everyone in the school and I am friends with several students in other grades, it is truly wonderful. All in all, this school is amazing, I’ve had a wonderful experience and the IB is a great opportunity....
Comment:Alum:awesome school Comment:great opportunities and teachers that care about you Comment:very good senior projects Comment:awesome college counselors...

Comment:Sophomore:The school has amazing resources! I feel so lucky to have access to technology and information that will help me get ready for college. However, the school environment definitely fosters bullying, and it often feels like most students don’t like each other. In general though, the school is pretty great compared to others even within the area!...

Comment:Alum:I spent 12 years learning at Maimonides, and I learned so much in my time there. I made friends and connections for life, and it will always feel like a second home. I had great days, and I also had some really bad ones - but what middle schooler doesn't? Maimonides is an amazing school and connects so many children with Judaism each year, and connected me personally so much deeper than I ever realized. The classes and teachers are incredible, and when you're a student you really feel good connections with the teachers, and you really feel like they care about you and your education and well-being....

Comment:Middle School Student:Al-Noor Academy is a beautiful and brilliant place to learn. If your looking for a school for your child to learn Islam, this is the perfect place. Al-Noor Academy offers many courses for such, like Islamic Sciences, Quranic Studies, and more. Additionally, the math, science, history, literature, and so many other courses are wonderful. The teachers care for each and every student to help them thrive in these rigorous classes. When you walk through the halls, you can sense the joy and happiness of the students and staff, similar to a bonded family. I have only been attending this school for 6 months in 8th grade, however I already feel at home and I've learned an unumerable amount of information in all subjects. Overall, Al-Noor Academy is an exceptional school, and your child will love it here!Comment:Sincerely, Comment:Sulayman...
Comment:Freshman:It's fun and great. Clubs are strong, food is nice, teachers are cool, sports are cool. Very fun, academically strong, W school....
Comment:Middle School Student:Teachers are for the most part amazing! Great community and great friends. I would recommend it for anyone who loves writing, art, and science....

Comment:Parent:I love this school! My son is loved and nurtured as well as academically enriched. I've recommended this school to friends and continue to be very happy to have my son attend school here....

Comment:Senior:Wayland High School has been a great fit for me. As a person who enjoys much of my academics, I've found that Wayland's been welcoming. Most of the staff is enthusiastic about their subject, and there's a strong culture of high level academics. Unfortunately, this does come at the cost that there's a significant bias against students in the institution who don't rise to those high expectations. No matter the performance of persons in higher level courses, their enrollment within them seems to bias them against those in the "intro level" courses....

Comment:Senior:At DS, academics are encouraged by many teachers. It is a small school with small class sizes and most teachers invest a lot of time into their students and jobs. There are some teachers that should discipline students more when they don't show up to class or blatantly disrespect them. As a student who always shows up to class and does her work, it is frustrating for me to see that other students get away with not doing the work and don't get any kind of disciplinary retaliation in response to it. Resources at this school are one of a kind. We have plenty of chromebooks for people to use if they don't have personal computers, desktops in the library, an abundance of textbooks for each class, and many different expensive supplies for labs and demonstrations. Students are engaged out of class with field trips as well which adds to excitement and encourages learning. Since this school is small, the student culture is not the best. Students often form cliques and don't include each other....

Comment:Works Here:I am a current employee and former parent at GISB. I find it a very welcoming, engaged, and progressive community of learning and culture for anyone interested in bilingual education and the opportunities this opens....

Comment:Parent:WMS has exceeded our expectations in providing a rigorous, supportive educational environment for our daughter. Weston is an affluent, relatively small community that offers well resourced schools. Comment:WHAT WE LIKEComment:--National Blue Ribbon SchoolComment:--Solid accountability ratings from state's ed deptComment:--Challenging, engaging curriculum—with strong core academics & a surprisingly diverse range of electives (from video production & music theory to engineering arts & robotics)Comment:--Teachers who're deeply committed to student success and who prioritize differentiated learning based on individual student needsComment:--Very high level of student engagement in variety of extracurriculars Comment:--Every student seems to have “a place”Comment:--Recent innovations: student-led, parent-teacher conferences; FLEX blocks; June AcademyComment:--Beautiful campus, with ample athletic fields embedded among forests, shared with Weston High SchoolComment:WHAT WE WISH WOULD CHANGEComment:--While well maintained, the WMS building is more than 50 years old...

Comment:Parent:We have been so happy with Chapel Hill-Chauncy Hall.  They have a terrific curriculum, a dedicated and talented suite of teachers and professional staff, and a beautiful campus.  From the moment our daughter started at CH-CH, she was welcomed with open arms.   The team there helped her as she joined as a transfer student and constantly kept us informed of her progress.  Whenever we reach out to teachers or staff, we get prompt and thoughtful insight.  The academic curriculum is excellent and the teachers are wonderful.  CH-CH truly CARES about their students and families and it shows up every day when our daughter goes to school.  We have been involved with other private schools for other children, and none compare to CH-CH in any aspect--academics, campus life and teachers/staff.  SImply the best....

Comment:Senior:LS is overall a really good school that I consider myself lucky to attend. Most of the teachers are engaging and kind, and I feel academically challenged but also supported. A major drawback is the culture here. Many students are constantly at each others' throats, talking behind people's backs and being extremely competitive because there is the expectation to get into a good college. It can be hard to take higher level classes and have to deal with people who are always trying to be better than everyone else....

Comment:Parent:My daughter attended Field School for fourth and fifth grade, having transitioned to it after completing K-3 at Weston's Woodland School. Despite the impacts of the pandemic, Field was an excellent experience for her: an outstanding principal, committed teachers who balance academic rigor with social and emotional learning, a beautiful facility and setting near forests and the Lands Sake farm, and large roster of engaged parent volunteers. It was an ideal combination of resources. The administration managed as best as it seemingly could during the pandemic. Weston Public Schools score lower on diversity, but in my experience, given attendance by METCO students (bused in from Boston Public Schools) and the broad range of nationalities represented by expats residing in the town, my daughter had friends and classmates from all walks of life....

Comment:Senior:My overall experience at Concord Carlisle has been very good. Although I am a minority (Asian-American) I still find myself very included. The teachers are generally good with some being excellent. The school also has very good resources for sports, music, arts, and other interests. There are many clubs and sports to get involved with. My peers at Concord Carlisle High School are very nice and friendly and I feel like I am cared about at my school. I am also getting a good education and I feel prepared for college....

Comment:Senior:The college counseling at Cats academy is exceptional, my personal college counselor Ms. Whalen has been very helpful this year for me and getting me ready to enter college in the next step of my academic career....

Comment:Senior:Westford Academy has been wonderful in preparing me for college and providing the resources I need to succeed. The school is very college-prep focused, sometimes to its detriment, as it fosters a very competitive academic environment. My experience at Westford Academy has been very pleasant and I have never felt as if there was nothing to do, with its diverse course offerings and extracurricular activities, there is something for every student. The staff has always been receptive to their students, wanting them to succeed and providing extra help if needed. I do wish there was more emphasis on school culture, as academics often trump and distract from any sense of community. It would be nice to be a more unified school. Overall I have had a good experience at Westford Academy and aside from the lack of a school community I wouldn’t change anything about it....

Comment:Senior:During my four years at Winchester High School, I've had many positive experiences and made great memories. The teachers work to create a perfect learning environment and are always available to help with whatever problems you may be having. There is also a great group of students with very few issues among each other....

abbreviation: Gen. John J. Stefanik Memorial School
school_name: Gen. John J. Stefanik Memorial School
review: Comment:Parent:My kids have been going here for many years. There have been many changes thru the years and it's all been to better the students as it's not a good area....
Comment:Parent:I love the school. My daughter has done great since starting here. Her teacher and IEP team are very communicative. Overall happy with this school...

Comment:Niche User:I loved the school and had a great time there. They have an amazing special ED program and really take the time to get to know their students better. THey always made sure inclusion was their top priotority....
Comment:Middle School Student:This place is wonderful teaches me better than my old school teachers and nice and I wish I found this place earlier...

Comment:Senior:My experience with Lynn classical high school has mixed feelings because it’s a place I spent the last four years of my life and so it’s kind of grown on me, but there is still some things at that school that could stand to change. In light of some experiences, some of the best that I’ve had at the school are all four years of pep rally, as well as junior prom, maybe it’s just big things, but I feel really immersed and get a sense of normalcy when I am presented the “high school experience.” Some of the worst experiences I remember, not even due to the school in particular, but due to the time it was, was Covid. The first couple months when I started high school academically speaking I wasn’t where I wanted to be, but Covid made it 10 times harder. From Wi-Fi connection to communication issues to deadlines. Thankfully, I found some footing and even made some friends over zoom that I still call my friends today. It’s one of the more challenging times during my high school experience....
Comment:Alum:I loved elementary school. teachers were always very nurturing and helpful, as well as forgiving. even when i called my first grade teacher mom by accident....

Comment:Works Here:Clearly, I might be biased however,  I think the Philbrick is a phenomenal learning space. Teachers are very dedicated to their students' learning and their social-emotional well being. We have constant conversations about areas for improvement and how we can make the school a better place. From what I've seen, teachers here are dedicated and want to have a positive impact on their students. There has been a fair amount of fluctuation in the leadership of the school but their are quality staff leading the charge. Right now, it seems that we are positioned to implement changes that will improve learning at the Philbrick. Please know that teachers and administrators are doing their best to help all students reach their potential. I know I can only speak for myself but this is why I'm here - to deliver quality instruction to all students....
Comment:Parent:Teachers and the administrators do really care. It's an old building with space for improvement. Overall a great community, good students, and excellent teachers. Ski club rocks!...

Comment:High School Senior:I learned a lot, I loved the bond I built with my teachers but now looking back to it, it wasn't challenging enough. I didn't feel as prepared entering my next level of education but other then that it's great. The teachers care and want you to do well. If you do all your work and listen you'll do great in this school....

Comment:Junior:Palmer High School is just like any other school in the western Massachusetts area, except for the fact our school combines middle and high school students in one building. At Palmer, you expect to find the same 10-12 kids in the same classes every year(depending on the classes you choose), along with recurring teachers for each subject(specifically math and science). Outside of academics, the sports scene is okay. Many games are attended, but those only apply to soccer or football. Less popular sports are barely attended and funded. Also, clubs are quite nonexistent, except for the one or two that have middle schoolers attending them....
Comment:Niche User:I loved my time at BMS! The teachers care so so much about the students! I learned so so much and the environment is so safe and loving and supportive....
Comment:Alum:This school is so great for kids. It is A lot of fun and tons of learning for the students. Some of the best teachers around....
Comment:Alum:The teachers were nice and the facilities were good, but behavioral issues of students were not always dealt with properly....
Comment:Parent:Great school, close community. The teachers, admin staff care about the kids development and it shows....

Comment:Alum:Great experience I loved be at melrose middle school.  The teachers, faculty all were amazing. Teachers care about students when whatever there something wrong about the students. They ask them what wrong....

Comment:Niche User:When I first started at Central, I did not want to open very much to people. I barely spoke english and I was afraid to be made fun of, so I stayed to myself. But the students reached out to me, I had a friend who I've always been close to, she showed me the ropes, and during a track event we had, even when we were in different teams, she stood by me through it all and I cannot be thankful....

Comment:Parent:The principal, teachers and staff are AMAZING! They know and care about each kid. There is a strong emphasis in training the kids to organize themselves and organize their thoughts and prepare to think critically. Recently diversity of staff has increased and new teachers are also fantastic. Have had excellent experience with counseling staff.  The building is being rebuilt so they are in temporary facilities in East Cambridge (in the Spring Street Kennedy Longfellow building) until 2025. It seems fine....
Comment:Parent:MGRHS is a very good school. There is plenty of opprtunity for advanced-level learning, including co-enrollment at nearby colleges like Williams....

Comment:Alum:I loved attending Medway High School.  The teachers were very accommodating and we were offered "Flex" blocks to give us time to work on studies that we were struggling with.  The sports teams seemed to be all inclusive, however the thing I did not like was the town seemed to allow politics and "parent/friend" involvement to judge what kids got the most playing time....

Comment:Parent:I have been very happy with the quality of the staff at the school and the activities provided.  I have always felt that my children are in good hands both socially and academically....

Comment:Parent:SLA is a small school, which I see as a positive. There is a low student-teacher ratio and the teachers truly care about my kids. My high school students are doing very well academically, scoring well above national averages on SATs....

Comment:Senior:Burlington high school is a pretty good school in terms of preparation for future college students, I feel as though this school well prepared me for my future, although the guidance counseling department does seem quite forgetful with sending important documents to students colleges they applied to, which concerns me....

Comment:Senior:Very light on coursework and highly engaged with its students. However, it doesn't prepare students for the rigorous environment that is present in middle school. The playgrounds are safe and the teachers are all caring. It is also very project-based....
Comment:Parent:My son went to this school.. i found everything excellent here...he is very happy studying there.. Teachers are very good i like this school....

Comment:Senior:Lawrence High transformed from an unlikely destination into profound self-discovery. Initially branded for "delinquents", I arrived masking insecurities. Yet amidst turmoil, LHS revealed an intellectual and compassionate oasis where I could heal.Comment:    I stumbled upon authenticity by defying conventions. A mentor whose wisdom transcended academia appeared. His empathetic words unlocked past traumas, allowing me to perceive strength. "You are a survivor," he uttered, salving self-doubt wounds. Our discourses delved into human experience depths and soul resilience. He embodied Lawrence's nurturing spirit - cultivating passions, unveiling untapped potential realms. Lawrence unveils the extraordinary within, transcends limits, discovers boundless inner potential.Comment:   Bonds with mentors and peers anchored me through adolescence, reminding me of self-worth. In twilight, I perceive Lawrence's splendor - a place where humanity's Poetry echoes through open corridors to those who listen....

Comment:Niche User:I have always had great contact with all of the staff at the Taft School. Teachers are caring and the communication between parents and teachers is second to none. The Principle, Mrs. Sirois is wonderful, attentive and in touch with staff, students and parents.Comment:I love the fact that the children, from Kindergarten, use computers and an iPad inside the classroom as technology is forever changing. I thing they are right on track with teaching our children skills that will be used every day.......
Comment:Middle School Student:I go to raynham middle school. They are the best. So friendly and no bad teachers. They are understanding and have everything you need for middle school....
Comment:Alum:Best experience I’ve had at a school overall. Started in 5th race and graduated my 8th grade with loving and caring peers as well as teachers....
Comment:Alum:Had an incredible experience and felt like home. However, I was disappointed in the lack of sports and art programs. Very focused on college readiness....

Comment:Senior:I feel as though my experience at Weymouth High School was one to remember. I have formed genuine bonds with numerous of the faculty members at the school, which made the days at the school fly by. I believe that I have always had a shoulder to lean on in school. The students at Weymouth High School are extremely diverse, which enables beneficial exposure to different cultures. I believe that the school could improve by ensuring that students are taking electives that interest them, rather than picking and choosing only for the benefit of credits....

Comment:Parent:Wonderful school with dedicated faculty and staff. The teachers truly take the time to get to know students and families, and there are always fun projects and events that keep kids loving school!...

abbreviation: Cape Cod Regional Technical High School
school_name: Cape Cod Regional Technical High School
review: Comment:Senior:Cape Tech has many resources for students in need whether that be someone to talk to or physical recourses they need. The faculty and administration is supportive and always willing to help. I feel more prepared for college when graduating Cape Cod tech than I would have if I were to graduate from a standard public high school...

Comment:Senior:We are a small community who has worked hard to build a community. However the block-scheduling system has put serious strain on my ability to take the classes I wish and are at my ability level. I love this school and I wish they continue to prove. Go Thunder!...

abbreviation: Berkshire Arts & Technology Charter Public School
school_name: Berkshire Arts & Technology Charter Public School
review: Comment:Middle school student:Hello, I'm an 8th grader at BART. I am nearing the end of my middle school experience here, so I can only account for years 6-8. BART is a relatively small school, so it's easy to build community and stick with it. The teachers here are very devoted to helping students learn---although you may not find yourself connecting with all teachers (if you know, you know).  Comment:Being a small school, BART has it's setbacks. The students here often joke about how laughably understaffed and "broke" this school is. I think that's a bit of an exaggeration, but it's partially rooted in truth. We don't have the budget for sustainable lunches. We tend to reuse food and settle for cheap (IF YOU KNOW, YOU KNOW).  Staff comes and goes. You may find yourself in a class without a teacher, instead alternating subs---though that isn't typical.Comment:Yet, this school does a great job at preparing students for college. Academically, this school exceeds. And again, it's easy to develop a strong community....

I have been involved in sports since my freshman year, I played volleyball as well as track and field. As a senior though, I feel as though my class has not been sufficiently prepared for the college admissions process. We have had no assemblies or anything like that this year about college since junior year. We had 1 I believe.
