Comment:Parent:They have helped my daughter greatly by catering to her above grade level needs! She is given extra work and all of the staff she interacts with work hard to challenger her and give her the ability to grow....

Comment:Middle school student:It was pretty swell ngl. I barely remember it because it is grade K-2 but it so slay. I think you should totally go there. They did have to call an ambulance recently and wouldn't tell anyone why, but I think it is fine....

Comment:Senior:As a senior reflecting on my high school journey, the best moments have undeniably been the connections forged in the crucible of adolescence. From shared laughter in the cafeteria to late-night study sessions, the camaraderie formed with friends has been the heartbeat of my high school experience. These relationships have not only made the academic challenges more bearable but have also been the source of countless cherished memories. On the flip side, the worst part has been the relentless pressure of academic expectations and the elusive pursuit of popularity. The stress of exams and the constant comparison to societal norms often overshadowed the joy of learning. If given the chance to influence change as a student, I would advocate for a more holistic education system—one that prioritizes individual growth over rigid standards. Creating a culture that celebrates diversity, creativity, and encourages personal development would make high school a better expierence...
Comment:Senior:Very good high school experience, lots of resources and helpful staff to help students move from highschool to college or other experiences....

Comment:Middle school student:This is a good school. The teachers are really nice. I would like more afterschool programs and specific areas to help with career choices instead of the simple math club, chess club, writing club. Maybe some STEAM, science etc....

Comment:Senior:My overall experience in Stoughton high school was great. I was able to learn how to interact with people from different cultures,age groups,and interest. I believe this school has some of the best teachers that actually support you and your future. I admire all the teachers I've had because they support me through thick and thin, they understand if there's problems and figures out how to fix them. This schools diversity is insane, this is the only school I've been too ,where I've seen so many people that come together and make a school welcoming. I enjoyed my four years of high school here even after COVID and all the things we had to deal with....

Comment:Junior:Without exaggeration, this school district is amazing! It offers an academic curriculum with a rigor that is completely dependent upon each students' preferences, with courses ranging from moderate to greatly challenging. All students within the school are unique characters and naturally amicable, and the teachers are as competent as they are kind....
Comment:Middle School Student:I was not there long, transfered in for 7th and 8th grade. It was a pleasant experience. Students, staff and teachers were all very kind...
Comment:Alum:One time I got sent to the principal's office for getting hit in the head with a lunchbox. But overall it was a good time....

Comment:Senior:I transferred in as a Junior and it was the hardest yet best decision I made. I wanted to be more challenged academically and they have over exceeded my expectations with the vigorous yet passionate academic classes. Comment:It was a challenge socially at first. I did know a lot of peers but groups were already established but I made the cheerleading team and that helped me feel confident about tackling the social piece, it just came naturally from there. Comment:As a Hispanic young lady in a catholic school, I would love to see more diversity and more clubs/classes that revolve around the Hispanic culture....

Comment:Parent:What parents might want to know about this school is what makes it unique from other public schools in the area. With enthusiasm and energy, it pursues a progressive agenda. Some people will like this and others will not.Comment:Your child will learn their true “identity” at this school, whether it is their race, gender or sexuality. They have a Rainbow Club where students can explore their LGBTQ sexuality and gender identity with adult support. While we were there, there were several students, none older than 11yrs, who were going by a different gender than the one they had been born to.Comment:As far as racial identity goes, do not be surprised if your child comes home one day and exclaims "I hate white people." The teachers are encouraged to go in depth around the exploration of crimes against humanity committed, as they tell it, exclusively by white people to people of color. Our child went on for a full month where almost every day she exclaimed her spite of her own “race.”...

Comment:Senior:My overall experience with St. Mary's has been very informative and disciplined. This school has given me numerous opportunities to give back to the community and to succeed academically and athletically. The worst part of my high school experience was my first 2 years of high school during the COVID pandemic. My interpersonal relations with classmates and faculty were dramatically impacted. Thankfully, St. Mary's implemented not only hybrid, but in person learning with PPE measures in place. The best part of my high school experience was being so involved with my school and the community, not only from being a scholar and an athlete, but with community service opportunities. The ability to engage with peers, faculty, administration, as well as first responders, law enforcement, and the Mayor. The networking opportunities were endless....

Comment:Senior:Scituate is a very mixed bag.  It may very well take the cake for the least diverse secondary school in the country (the upper 90% is of Irish Catholic descent) and what few students of color who attend live in the Boston metro area.   Despite this, academics are honestly quite strong, and individuals can feel prepared for higher education if they're willing to put in the work and hours.  Scituate has a remarkably solid trend of sending anywhere from 2-5 students per year to the nation's top colleges.  The administration this year has totally changed, which has been poorly managed and aimed solely at stifling senior "privileges" and hounding minor infractions while ignoring the drug problems the school continues to struggle with.  The fine arts department is fantastic; the STEM opportunities are student-driven but supported by devoted faculty, as long as you're not interested in taking engineering courses.  The food is abysmal and students can't use their own laptops/devices....
Comment:Niche User:Wouldn't want my kids to go anywhere else....

Comment:Parent:This is a great school! The principal is amazing and he knows all of the kids by there first name. He sends out a monthly blog on what is going on in the school and how parents can get involved. Great community feel and all of the parents are heavily involved....

Comment:Senior:In all I would say that Old Rochester has given me more memorable experiences than horrible ones. I've made some of my best friends here, and discovered what I wanted to do for the rest of my life within these walls. Every teacher is different, so I can't really group them all together as a whole, but for the most part I've learned a lot from them. If I had to change anything about this school it would be the disregard for the arts in some senses. I am part of the dance team and we are continuously pushed aside for the other sports at the school. The principal is also a soccer coach, so he sees things from that point of view....

Comment:Alum:While my time at this school was short, I genuinely loved it. The teachers, especially Mr. Amaral (shoutout to him!), were fantastic. The school's culture was amazing, and both the administration and the opportunities provided were outstanding. I haven't seen such opportunities at other schools in the area. Go Durfee Hilltoppers! Comment:Senior:Greater Lowell has provided me with an excellent technical education, allowing me to get a head start in my field of Information Technology. I've had access to countless programs such as the Greater Lowell Summer Enrichment Program, SkillsUSA, National Honor Society/National Technical Honor Society, and participated in various activities such as sports and clubs to build my leadership character....

Comment:Senior:After moving to the U.S. and working incredibly hard, I am no longer in ESL classes. However, I had teachers who found it hard to accept my grammar, mispronunciation, or even my accent. But, not Ms. Moore. She would always have writing templates and supplemental visual materials that I could use whenever needed. Despite her support, she always kept high expectations, knowing I could always do better. For example, in our identity unit, I had to create a project about who I am. I wrote a letter to no one in particular. Ms. Moore saw my potential and pushed me to do better. I wrote seven poems representing myself. When she graded me; She mentioned my growth in changing and adjusting, creativity, and vulnerability I have shown. I completed the project in English and Spanish and still, I sometimes look back at it for a quick reminder of who I am and who I would like my future to be. I wish there were more teachers like Ms. Moore to push students to look for their potential without judgment....

Comment:Senior:COVID happened during freshman year so high school experience was not normal.  It made it such that we didn't have mid terms nor finals and therefore I feel I am at a disadvantage for starting my college schooling. I did have great opportunities to take AP classes and use those credits in college (or will be).  I also was able to participate in many clubs and organizations as well as sports.  There were not limits as to what you could or could not participate in.  I did Robotics which was a huge influence in my college field of study.Comment:Things to change.  Communication was okay but not as good as it could have been given the size of the school.  Follow through was in essence non existent. More classes geared towards life - like balancing a check book, how to get a car or a loan, how to multitask and prepare for assignments.  Cooking and being self sufficent.   The ability to be able to be well rounded from school, activities, sports and clubs was huge....

Comment:Middle School Student:A very nice school. Great principals (I have been with 3 different assistant principals, 2 different principals), and they all are kind, funny, and generous. There is no bullying, other than the kind that everyone (including the victim) thinks is funny, except for the adults. There is very great education, the teachers help everyone understand, and will help each and every student succeed. There is pretty good sports. The food served in the cafeteria is very delicious. Although  the COVID-19 pandemic, there is still hot lunch. Since the virus is still around, the school decided to let the lunches be free, especially since about 15% of the children's families are in debt and don't have a lot to eat. That is my summary of CMS. Definitely recommend this school!...

Comment:Senior:I've had more good teachers than bad. You can tell that some of the teachers are very passionate about what they teach and that transfers to the learning environment heavily.  There's a lot of student fights that break out. The school is also predominately white. I'd like to see more diversity....

Comment:Senior:Attending Josiah Quincy Upper School from 6th to 12th grade has been average, but I wouldn't want ant other experience. It's a small public high school offering the IB curriculum for free which I'm very thankful for. IB is naturally difficult than a regular high school, but our teachers are mostly very prepared to guide us to success.  Since the amount of students are small, and majority of them have known each other since kindergarten, it can be tiring to see the same people daily, but having such a tight community has benefits. Teachers can learn about your personal life, and accommodate to your needs much better. JQUS is more academic focused than arts or sports which is a bummer for me personally, but we become much more college prepared before other students. I know JQUS as a school try their very best to be there for us in many ways. The community gets better as times goes on, especially with society becoming much more open-minded...

abbreviation: Tri-County Regional Vocational Technical High School
school_name: Tri-County Regional Vocational Technical High School
review: Comment:Senior:I had to weigh the pros and cons of applying to my local school or the vocational high school. One had all of my friends, and it was within my comfort zone. But, Tri-County had opportunities far beyond anything I could achieve elsewhere. It has been an extraordinary experience for me. Comment:My high school’s vocational engineering program has provided me with opportunities to develop an appreciation of collaboration, competition, and problem solving. During high school, I worked on a NASA HUNCH project where I was selected to present nationally. I had additional experiences developing solutions to real-life problems, including SkillsUSA District and State competitions. Comment:I am delighted to continue my educational journey, but I will certainly miss everything about my high school; The teachers and faculty that I have had the pleasure of meeting, the vocational shops that shaped my future, and simply the school spirit. I would not change a thing about my experience....
Comment:Parent:My daughter started at Centerville this year. It is a great community with great administration. She is learning a lot and seems to be very happy....

Comment:Middle School Student:I used to go here a long time ago and it was amazing the teachers were great the food was pretty good not like a five star chef but like good enough for a six year old a teacher hit me in the back of my head three times with a basketball once though...

abbreviation: Springfield High School of Science & Technology
school_name: Springfield High School of Science & Technology
review: Comment:Senior:My school, like most Springfield Public schools, have many students who arrive to school feeling as though their teachers and administrators have low expectations for them. It's important for the students in our communities to feel as though they belong, and that the administrators surrounding them everyday care for them.  I have a good number of teachers who make me feel as though I belong, and that I will achieve great things, but my experience cannot be said for all--this is something I hope may change. Where every student, no matter their differences feel as though they are somewhere they can be themselves and flourish in, be it clubs dedicated to their hobbies or interests, or elective classes that they may find interesting, or even just a teacher that they can connect strongly with. All these factors make a school a close community, and one day we'll be able to get there as more students and administrators insist on change....

Comment:Niche User:My cousin goes to the school and tells me alot about the school. He like it so much that he wakes up early every day just to get ready for a school day. Our family is very music oriented so when he found out that his school offers music he was so happy and tells us each and every day about what they learn  in music class. He also loves art so since the school offered art it was a bonus for him. The school id very diverse so as an African American male he felt at home and had no problem fitting in with the others...
Comment:Alum:Loved it. Amazing diversity, and teachers. Parents are heavily involved and the school really is a community....

Comment:Freshman:Quinsigamond is a great option for community college in western Massachusetts. It is well known throughout the state. Multiple scholarships are available for application, and the student life team works hard to plan events that apply to all students. There are plenty of useful student services that can be taken advantage of.  Building and grounds are mainly well kept, typical community college. I am happy with my experience thus far....
Comment:Alum:Loved this school. Everyone was absolutely lovely. Really great, passionate teachers who you will say 'hi' to for years to come....

Comment:Parent:My daughter is just starting there tuesday. So once she in there for awile see how it goes. To my satisfaction....

Comment:Parent:My don goes to this school and knew how to read the first month he started there. They whole school staff is nice. The principal is so sweet,Mr Donavan. He knows all the kids by their name including my son. That's shows me he knows he kids and he cares....
Comment:Senior:i think that its a pretty average highschool but its what you make of it the students that try do good and the students that dont try dont do good...

abbreviation: New Heights Charter School of Brockton
school_name: New Heights Charter School of Brockton
review: Comment:Senior:I started attending New Heights Charter School of Brockton in my eight grade year. I have never attended or heard of a charter school before so I was excited but also nervous. I transferred in the middle of eighth grade so I came a month after the school year already started, that made me incredibly uneasy. That feeling did not last long and was overtaken by the feeling of happiness, satisfaction, and gratitude. I was so happy that I transferred to New Heights Charter School, the biggest reason why is the community. Both the students and teachers are so pleasing and wonderful. I was satisfied with the environment I was going into every morning and was so grateful that school was so enjoyable and comfortable for me, which is all because of the supportive environment New Heights provides. The teachers are always open  to help you with whatever and the counselors and faculty assist you greatly in such a friendly manner. I am now a senior and everyday I am glad I transferred to this school...

Comment:Alum:The school has amazing teachers who do more than you could ever imagine with what they are given. Unfortunately, administration has lost many of these amazing teachers due to mismanagement over the past few years. Students can enjoy their time at the school, but there is nothing left holding the students and school together....

abbreviation: Hill View Montessori Charter Public School
school_name: Hill View Montessori Charter Public School
review: Comment:Parent:My child has been there since kindergarten and thrives in the Hillview Montessori environment. He has been extremely lucky to have the most patient and kind teachers in lower elementary. They have done phenomenal throughout the pandemic as well. Everyone is very welcoming and they create a very family like atmosphere. They teach the students how to be a kind and active community members....

Comment:Alum:Claremont Academy is a welcoming place to go. The teachers were great, very helpful and always available and offering to help. If anything the school was opportunistic, giving ways to help others, like their Community service club, helping to understand oneself and seeing if helping other's is a passion they want to pursue as well as assisting them in hopes on how they would like help more in the world.Comment:With pros comes cons, most of the clubs like those were soon cut due to its lack of support. For example, their babysitting program that went alongside with their English learning program for parents, were cut due to lack support and due to covid.Comment:Overall, what I would like see changed would be their funding, most schools have a lot of support on their funding but from my experience we weren't given a lot of luxuries, if anything we were given a lot of false promises, most of them would have been avoided per proper funding and support....

abbreviation: Thomas V. Nash Jr. Primary School
school_name: Thomas V. Nash Jr. Primary School
review: Comment:Middle School Student:when i went to nash it was honestly the best all the teachers and staff are so nice and caring and make you feel like your at home and safe, the academics are very good and all the athletics and sports events are so fun the food is so good and the staff act like there family and they make you feel welcome i had the best experience there and i would go back any day i am now in 7th grade and i moved to a different part of weymouth and that school was nothing compared to nash i missed nash so much your very lucky if your child or children go there and make the best out of it because all good thinks must come to a end...

Comment:Freshman:This place is amazing. The staff and teachers are kind and caring, and there is not a better place to make elementary school memories. It is an all-inclusive and caring school that I truly love....

Comment:Senior:I have enjoyed my time at Case High. When struggling with my mental health guidance, teachers and staff were very supportive and accommodating to my needs. I don’t have much to say about social aspects as I am a big introvert, but I have never been bothered or bullied. Almost everyone is nice, some can be obnoxious, but that can be said for every high school. All the teachers that I’ve had here have been very nice and knowledgeable in their subjects, and also just generally enjoyable people to be around. I will miss many of them when I graduate. I don’t know much about the theater and band programs, but I do know they are very successful in competitions. Our football team currently kinda sucks but it’s all in good fun and there’s still a lot of excitement around football games. School spirit is pretty high, spirit week is always pretty lively and fun....

Comment:Senior:The best parts of being at Medford High School are the sport available because my whole life I have wanted to play volleyball. Being a boy playing volleyball at a high school is challenging because they don't always have the opportunity to have a boys team but they did junior year. Ever since I have started to play volleyball, I have mad amazing friends and memories connected with the high school. The worst parts of this high school is the violence because they are always school fights, there was a stabbing last year, and the bullying can get out of hand at times. Changes I would like to see is the school environment because the bulling can get really out of hand....
Comment:Middle School Student:There is not much bullying in this school and teachers are great and teach Nicely the kids just lack diversity...
Comment:Junior:It’s a good community and most of the teachers are amazing. Though there aren’t many classes you can take and some teachers are not that great....

Comment:Senior:Plymouth North has fantastic resources for those willing to work hard enough to find them. North provides students with a diverse and accommodating atmosphere. The biggest change I would make would be relocating funds. I think some sports teams get more attention than others and some departments receive more money than others. I think that each aspect of North should be treated equally....

Comment:Senior:I had a really great time at Foxborough Regional Charter School. The academics were top-notch and I felt like I learned a lot while I was there. The students were all really friendly and welcoming, and I made some great friends during my time there. The staff were also really fun and always willing to help out if I had any questions or needed any assistance. Overall, it was a really positive experience and I'm grateful for the opportunity to have attended such a great school....
Comment:Parent:We had a great experience with great teachers. Any issue we had was resolved very quickly. We enjoyed our 4 years at the high school....

Comment:High School Senior:Every year Midland Street Elementary School has a walk for education, where very student,teacher,or volunteer walk around  a nearby park. By doing so, parents,friends,relatives,etc., pay their funded child a certain amount for every lap that they do. It was my favorite activity because I was doing something good, and I was apart of something big, something that was actually making an impact....

Comment:Senior:I enjoyed NCAHS because it allowed me to experience the agricultural world in a way I would not have otherwise. I participated in cow shows, vaccinated baby goats, and restrained snakes all on a normal school day. The campus is gorgeous and being able to walk outside between classes is a huge plus. Academically NCAHS could use a little polishing. There are no APs and recently there has been a lot of turnover in the teaching department. If you are looking for a unique school with hands-on activities NCAHS should definitely be on your list!...

abbreviation: Christa McAuliffe Regional Charter Public School
school_name: Christa McAuliffe Regional Charter Public School
review: Comment:Alum:I personally loved my experience going to McAuliffe. I graduated several years ago, but many things I was taught there still stick with me. I used to remind many of my peers that most of the time, it isn't the school: middle school is supposed to be terrible for everyone. There's no way around it. However at McAuliffe, they do their best to shape their students into better individuals. The teachers there put so much time and effort into their work and they want their students to have the best possible opportunities. There is an extensive range of clubs as well as many sports offered. The school is smaller than the other middle schools in town, but it fosters a welcoming and tight knit community. Instead of regular "specials" (gym, music, art) they offer unique classes (Adventure, Wellness, and T4L2/Design) that are different every year. Not every loves this school, but I think that it is a wonderful opportunity to grow not just as students but as young adults....

Comment:Niche User:Great school, more like a family. Mr G and Mr Hill are some real ones. This school gives kids the opportunity to do something with their life’s no matter how far out that person feels. Best school I’ve ever been too....

Comment:Senior:Saint Mary's is a tight nit community that is so open and welcoming to all of its students. The faculty and staff are always willing to put in the extra time to help students in whatever challenges they may face....

Comment:Senior:My school has given me access to excellent resources and experiences. I have had the opportunity to pursue incredible opportunities both personally and professionally. I have had the opportunity to take part in several sports teams and student organizations, including being treasurer of my schools student council executive board. I have also received incredible academic opportunities ranging from teachers I have had, to AP courses I have been able to take. I have had four years with supportive and successful staff, students, and others who have allowed me to succeed....

Comment:Senior:Great school, teachers are very helpful.   They are very aware about their students and the needs of the community that is is located.  The offer assistance to all students with no judgement...
Comment:Niche User:School definitely rallies around students who are in tough situations....
Comment:Parent:The teachers here are absolutely amazing! My son has already learned so much in the year he has attended....

Comment:Senior:The strong community that was constantly built and maintained throughout the school was what drove me to make my decision of spending my 4 years at this school. Every school can have great academics and great teachers but it’s nothing compared to the love that is shared in this community and the drive to see each other succeed. I was chosen to represent our school’s Early College Program in a Boston Globe article where I shared my experience as a participant in the first year of the program at my school. These college classes not only prepare us for the college classroom environment with other college students, but also allow us to explore what career we may want to pursue after high school. Fenway High does an amazing job to help us not only in academics but also beyond that and extends to college preparatory level. Fenway High School is definitely a place where you can work hard, be yourself, and do the right thing....
Comment:Senior:I learned a lot, I liked almost all of my teachers, made good friends, and had found out what my passion is....

Comment:Senior:I think since I’ve been to this school since elementary school I have a pretty long history with it. It is a good school and it does offer opportunities that I know I wouldn’t get anywhere else. But they do need to improve in some aspects and there are some times where I think favoritism gets some students farther than others....

Comment:Parent:The Ryan is an amazing school with tons of activities for kids in grades 5 and 6. Caring teachers who go out of their way to help each one of their students do their very best. Great parent communication. Couldn't be more pleased with my experience....

Comment:Parent:The King Open community is an amazing one- supportive, engaged, and diverse. King Open focuses on social justice as its theme, which means it's integrated into the day to day curriculum rather than being a one-off topic. The school spends more time on Project Based Learning and Social Emotional Learning than most schools in Cambridge, which contribute greatly to the school's atmosphere. Teachers and staff alike are dedicated and highly skilled. King Open also houses the Olá Program, Cambridge's dual immersion Portuguese language track (you need to sign up for this program separately in the lottery). Olá teaches children in Portuguese half the day and English half the day. No Portuguese knowledge or background is needed (most kids in the classes don't have any connection to Portuguese). King Open will be moving into a brand new facility in Fall 2019. Love this school and community!...

Comment:Senior:Trivium school has taught me how to appreciate literature, philosophy, the use of rhetoric, and much more. Most importantly, the Trivium education has helped me to become a well rounded person; pushing me to grow and excel in my studies, athletics,  spiritual life, and community service....

Comment:Alum:Walpole High was a very welcoming environment when I transferred in for my senior year. My teachers and counselor were kind and patient, and the academics were pretty good. The food was okay, that would be the only slightly negative thing I'd have to say. I really hope they get the funding they deserve to upgrade some of the facilities though!...
Comment:Parent:Everything was great and the teachers were great they were all very nice and the school was very nice and the classrooms were very nice and they had a lot of space too....

Comment:Senior:My overall experience at Quincy high school has been better for the most part. Throughout my 4 years I have had very few bad experiences and lots of good. Comment:Parent:We are so grateful to have discovered Shore when my oldest was in 2nd grade at a local public school.  His transition to Shore was seamless and the teachers immediately engaged with him in a way he had not experienced before.  The interplay of academic challenge and social-emotional learning was exactly what our family was hoping to see play out in our son's education.  At every grade level, the teachers are exceptional and create deep, nurturing relationships with students.  Shore institutions like the Big Buddy program, the House System and the 3rd grade Olympic festival are foundational experiences for students and bring out the best in both children and adults on campus.  Upper School sports (grades 6-9) were a great opportunity to try new things, mix with students in other grade levels and share school spirit.  There are tons of opportunities for parents to volunteer and be a part of the community as well.  We are so thankful to have found Shore!...

Comment:Sophomore:I am currently in high school. I went to Pierce School starting in Kindergarten, all the way up to 6th grade, before switching to a 7-12 school in Boston. I won't give any names, but I had a horrible experience in Kindergarten. My teacher was racist and was extremely bias against me. I remember vividly getting harassed nearly everyday for not fitting in. There was one day when I got punched by another student, and so as a naive kindergartner, I told my teacher that someone punched me in the face.  But the teacher just straight up called me a liar. The next time the person punched me, I returned a punch, as per the Golden Rule - Treat others the way you want to be treated. The teacher saw us fight and ended up pulling me to the side, yelling at me. My year as a kindergartner ruined my self-esteem and changed me into a very shy person, becoming always scared of the surroundings. The reason I gave this a 4-star was because Mr. Weinstein was the best teacher in 1st, I could ever hope for....

Comment:Senior:My experience at Westwood High School has been very unique. As I spent my four years learning, growing, and reasoning, I acquired skills like knowledge, especially about life's obstacles. Academically, Westwood has fortified my management, priorities, and curiosity, allowing me to develop into a creative and compelling student. However, there were times when I felt excluded, especially when it came to athletics. But, I did not let that moment define me or stifle my hard work. With the help of my friends and family, I pushed myself to the limit and worked to show how this setback would exhibit my perseverance and grit. And when I completed the hard work, it yielded great results. The high school experience can be overwhelming with ordeals and stresses, yet they shape our character and expectations for the rollercoaster of life. These adversities also built resilience and empathy, instilling positive and negative memories in me during my journey at Westwood High School....

Comment:Parent:I honestly can’t say enough about St. Joseph School in Wakefield. I have sons in 6th grade and 7th grade. The small class sizes allow for individualized attention. This school has some of the most creative, unique, caring teachers that I’ve ever encountered. The creative writing program is second to none. It is excellent preparation for their rigorous middle school program that will prepare them well for any high quality private or public high school. Our students are known for their comfort in public speaking; they get a lot of practice. Comment:Middle School Student:Throughout my years at Hingham Public Schools I have faced harsh challenges. Including; bullying, lack of diversity, and some unintentional racism. But, because of it all it has made me a better person. At this school they take pride in supporting advanced students, and students that need a little extra help. As the new generations of students come and go, teachers update their curriculum and activities to engage all students. Their work is informative, but not demanding. And the teachers are willing to stay after school or for lunch to work on topics that you might not understand. Despite the aforementioned challenges, I would not leave this school if I was forced. The academics are college-worthy, and Hingham Middle School is definitely teaching for a better future....

Comment:Recent Alumnus:Going to Champion High School changed my life. Half way through high school i changed schools because i wasn't doing well at my other school. Coming to Champion helped me refocus on my goals and that school helped me boost up my ambition and helped me become the smart young women i am today with dreams awaiting to come true....

Comment:Senior:Charlestown High school is a very good school. It has awesome teachers, who understand that some students learn differently from others, and they take time to make sure that these students are included in their lessons. The only real issue I have about CHS is that the building is old and some parts of the building, like water fountains and bathrooms, are a little outdated and need to be redone. Other than that I can confidently say CHS is a great school with awesome teachers and faculty members....

abbreviation: Dr. William W. Henderson K-12 Inclusion School Upper Campus
school_name: Dr. William W. Henderson K-12 Inclusion School Upper Campus
review: Comment:Parent:Amazing school with amazing staff. They offer after school with many different activities 4 days a week for free. It's safe the teachers are amazing as is the administration. I feel my daughter is safe and getting a top notch education along with multiple extra curricular activities most of which are totally free to do and if they do charge there's always some option to get help with the costs if needed. It's an inclusion school so they don't segregate the kids with ILP'S which I think is pretty messed up to begin with and they focus time teaching the kids to be inclusive what that truly means and to be kind and accepting of people who might be different from you. We came from a very wealthy small country town which I assume their schools budget out weighs this schools budget by a massive amount yet my child gets better education here, more teachers, smaller classes, extra curricular activities, more field trips, cooler hands on learning experiences not sure how but they make it happen...

Comment:Middle School Student:I graduated this year and overall it was good. There were many changes in this school, so many things were happening in your face. I wouldn't give out too much information because it's up to you to experience.  Good Luck :> and congrats everyone who graduated this year 2020...

Comment:Parent:Teachers and administration are very responsive, and use apps to communicate with parents often. The school is using Eureka Math as well as programs such as ST Math which are innovative and helping my daughter develop a deep understanding of math. She loves going to school, and the events are so well organized. We always planned on moving out of Lowell, but have had such a favorable experience as part of the Morey School community our plans have changed. We couldn't be happier that we landed at the Morey....
Comment:Parent:My Daughters are at school  and their teachers are so understanding , helpful, caring and respectful! My girls love the school Comment:Thank you so much...

Comment:Alum:My education at Nashoba Tech prepared me for both the workforce and college. During my time there, I was offered professional job opportunities, which was great for both academic reinforcement and professionalism as a whole. I think if anything could change for the better, it would be the ways in which conflicts between students were handled. There was often disregard for certain students for unknown reasons, forcing some people to have to go to school in a slightly uncomfortable situation....

Comment:Senior:Best: The best experiences I have had within this school have been within sports and the community that is felt within the family you build as a team and the support felt by coaches.Comment:Worst: The worst experiences I have had within this school have been this year, stemming from me and a few of my classmates having to take classes online as no teachers are offering to teach certain classes. This has resulted in multiple instances where I and my classmates have had questions without a source of answers.Comment:Change: If I was able to change one thing about the school it would be regarding the limited freedom allowed to those who are on break/study periods....

Comment:Alum:This is the elementary school I went to. Everything seems to be about the same if not better. I was able to do my Observation hours (Pre-Practicum) at the school I originally went to. It would be great to receive this scholarship because it will help me towards my future carrier goals which is to be an elementary music class teacher. The 2 teachers I observed are great teachers. a few of the teachers I had before I left are still here.  I think the children at this school are getting a great education! I wish for these students to all grow up to be great members of society in the real world. Thank you for taking your time in consider me for this scholarship....

Comment:Senior:Everyday at Excel high school I going in with a mindset ready to learn and reach my goals. My teachers and peers help me with my work. My experience at excel is overall a good experience...

Comment:Works Here:This is a great school!  The teachers are very knowledgeable, caring and work well together to benefit the students.  There is less technology integration and seamlessness across the district that could be improved.  The special education program is good....

Comment:Senior:I've been at Atlantis Charter School since I was a kindergartner. My overall experience has definitely changed over time. There are certain teachers that have always been very dependable and i'm highly grateful for that. I believe that COVID-19 also had a huge impact on not only the teachers but it took a toll on the students as well. Which leads into my high school year, a lot of teachers have been resigning from their position leaving us without a teacher and its been very hard to get comfortable again and learn with full capability.  The change I would like to see here at Atlantis Charter School is consistency to better the students and their learning....

Comment:Junior:Fellowship Christian Academy is a wonderful school that helps guide and nurture its students from preschool to graduation. Though the school is small and there are not as many opportunities within, the teachers are knowledgeable and the class sizes allow for a more personal learning experience....

Comment:Alum:I had a great experience at Holen Rcihmond. I attended school there from fall 2011-spring 2014. The teachers were so caring and always worked with the students and parents to make sure that every student succeeded....
Comment:Other:Miscoe Hill is an overall solid school. This school's academics are extremely good. In the end I would strongly recommend Miscoe hill...
Comment:Parent:I loved how the teachers were involved with my students every day activities.  I loved the safety the school provides for it's students....
Comment:Senior:I loved it, the student body council was very active and I enjoyed the variety of classes that were offered as well as the different opportunities...

Comment:Alum:In my time at Taunton High School, I was a member of the band where I made many new friends and was able to have amazing experiences thanks to the teachers and the opportunities they gave use. For example, we performed in Disney World in Florida, participated in all-city performances, had access to districts, and had meet ups to perform with and for other bands around Mass. For change, I would like for some of the teachers to be more understanding of students and the individual issues and circumstances they may have. Overall though, I enjoyed my time at Taunton High School....
Comment:Junior:This school was so good for me. They gave me advanced work because I was ahead of my grade. Im in 11th grade now, but I loved my time here....

Comment:Alum:As an alumnus of the Snowden International High School, I can say that the school's impact on students plays a big role in one's future. I am a college freshman and can say that the schools have taught and prepared me well for what I was about to face when taking another step into life. The school provided me with much help and guidance both educationally and socially. As an IB student, I could easily adapt to the workload brought to me as a college student thanks to the school's two-year IB program. However, I feel as though the school could use a few improvements in the administration in terms of building the community in the school....
Comment:Niche User:This school is amazing!! Love it. Always teaches good. All subjects are fun and easy. Go here if you're looking for a good school to teach and educate you well!...

Comment:Senior:I have enjoyed my highschool years at sizer through sports, clubs, and activities. The only thing I wish would change about sizer school would be having more students engage in the activities....

Comment:Parent:This school is second to none. It has amazing, dedicated staff, the parents are down to earth and engaged and the kids are friendly. I actually moved to another school district in the city but requested to stay because Lincoln Eliot is really the hidden gem in Newton. The PTO is hard working and focused, the special education team is amazing, the educators are impressive, the janitors are awesome and the student body is beautifully diverse. We could not ask for more!...

abbreviation: Pioneer Valley Chinese Immersion Charter School
school_name: Pioneer Valley Chinese Immersion Charter School
review: Comment:Senior:PVCICS has a great education program. Being such a small school all the teachers are able to get to know each student, giving them 1 on 1 attention, and being able to stop and answer any questions as needed in class. Students have a very close community along with each other and teachers throughout the building and multiple grades. The work load is a lot and can be very stressful. However the opportunity to learn Chinese is very cool and they have a great program, especially if you start in Kindergarten, to help students pick up the language quick. Comment:As far as offerings outside of academics, there are many different clubs available to high schoolers. The sports program is slowly growing and we have many amazing teams that are doing very well and increasing in strength every year. The school does put on some fun events throughout the year, such as movie nights, prom, etc., but those are also limited. Comment: If you are looking to really focus on academics PVCICS is definitely the place to go!...

Comment:Senior:Overall, my experience with Oliver Ames High School has been mostly satisfactory, yet there are several points of address necessary for improvement. To begin, the faculty at Oliver Ames are all superb, from the teachers to administration to the janitors and lunch ladies, all of the staff have been incredibly dedicated to their responsibilities and kind and courteous in everyday settings. In all of my courses, the teachers I have had have been passionate and knowledgeable in their fields, but also understanding and accepting of any extraneous circumstances. Further, Oliver Ames offers a wide range of courses to take and extracurricular activities to choose from. However, there were a few parts of my experience that were not as satisfactory; specifically, I would like to see the implementation of more mental health resources and career pathway opportunities. Perhaps partnerships with local colleges and businesses could allow students to explore more career avenues....

Comment:Senior:Overall my experience at Cardinal Spellman has been mostly positive. One of the highlights of my school would be in its diversity of people and teachers, this proves to be beneficial in having somewhere to go for advice. Additionally, the sports and club culture is so fruitful and makes you feel at home. The worst parts of my experience would be the food where I would like for the school body to put more emphasis on food selection as health is a key component to a person's wellbeing....

review: Comment:Niche User:The staff is friendly, current to 21st century curriculum and willing to help parents ,grandparents and students to make learning a great experience. Comment:Improvement - the drop off and pick up better known as the loop. Town needs to open up the access road so we can exit school .  Time consuming with just one exit due to fact that Dpw uses it too. They have huge construction equipment trying to get out and all the family cars trying to get in and out....
Comment:Alum:My child, Oliver, Said that he has an easy time making friends here, though otherwise, it's difficult....

Comment:Senior:A huge weight on my high school experience was COVID-19. I never thought my freshman year of high school would be jeopardized by a world wide virus restricting me from meeting new people and forming friendships. My school handled this very well, although we had to wear masks and remain 6 feet apart, they made sure we were welcomed to our new school. Fast forward four years later, we are mask free, no social distancing, the world has a handle on COVID and everything is relatively back to "normal". The summer going into my senior year, I find out all sports teams and Bishop Fenwick are not allowed to play in the MIAA playoffs. Now it wasn't a virus jeopardizing my senior year, but a mistake made by my school's administration. With Fenwick taking pride in our sports teams this was a huge loss. Fenwick's perseverance through this situation is why I chose to go there my freshman year and why I am proud to say I am alumni of Bishop Fenwick....
Comment:Parent:amazing school teachers soooooo nice and kind very good grades and improvements. This school has an amazing comunity....

Comment:Middle School Student:McCarthy is overall it is a pretty good school. But my biggest problem is that I feel like if you are gifted and prone to success you will definitely excel. But if you are a weaker student, the school does very little to help you get better. The teachers are very varied. Some are very kind, supportive, and effective, while other give off a vibe that they hate their job or the students. Safety is pretty average. Fights happen every so often among the older students. I think that the biggest thing this school has going for it, are the clubs. There are 15+ different clubs run by teacher that are fun. Another big thing this school has going for it is the culture. McCarthy has a great sense of pride shared by students and staff alike. We have spirit weeks, food can drives, marathons, socials, movie nights just to name a few. Overall McCarthy is a very decent school that, with enough hard work, can get kids far in life. Anyways, I should keep working on my homework....

Comment:Senior:Masconomet is a great place to make new friends and to get involved in many diverse extracurriculars. Our art program is one of the top ranging from classes of sculpting, drawing, painting, and photography. We have very understanding teachers with many different levels of academic rigor and extra help periods incase students have questions. Our school has lots of spirit with pep rallies and spirit days leading up to vacations and big sports games....
Comment:Middle school student:Most of the teachers are very nice and depending on what group you hang out with the kids are either nice or really judgmental...
